CO-TENANCY AND SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT THIS CO-TENANCY AND SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT (this "Agreement") is entered into as of February __, 2014 (the "Agreement Date"), by and among PUMPJACK SOLAR I, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company ("Pumpjack"), RIO BRAVO SOLAR I, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company ("Bravo I"), RIO BRAVO SOLAR II, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company ("Bravo II"), and DUKE ENERGY RENEWABLE SERVICES, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (the "Manager") (Pumpjack, Bravo I, Bravo II, and the Manager, individually, a "Party," and collectively, the "Parties"). RECITALS: A. Pumpjack is developing a solar photovoltaic electricity generating facility with a rated capacity of 20 MW on an approximately 157 acre site near McKittrick, California, as shown on Exhibit A (the "Pumpjack Project"). The Pumpjack Project is at a more advanced stage of development than either the Bravo I Project or the Bravo II Project (each as defined below). B. Bravo I is developing a solar photovoltaic electricity generating facility with a rated capacity of 20 MW on an approximately 157 acre site in the vicinity of the Pumpjack Project, as shown on Exhibit A (the "Bravo I Project"). C. Bravo II is developing a solar photovoltaic electricity generating facility with a rated capacity of 20 MW on an approximately 166 acre site in the vicinity of the Pumpjack Project, as shown on Exhibit A (the "Bravo II Project"). The Pumpjack Project, the Bravo I Project, and the Bravo II Project shall each be referred to as a "Project" and together as the "Projects." D. In connection with the Pumpjack Project, Pumpjack will design, construct, and own, on the land described in Exhibit B (such land, the "Shared Premises") a substation together with a generator interconnection line and other associated facilities connecting the Pumpjack Project to the transmission system owned by Pacific Gas and Electric Company ("PG&E") and controlled by the California Independent System Operator Corporation ("CAISO"). A portion of such interconnection facilities, including the 115 kV common bus, SCADA switch, and a short span of conductor, all as more particularly identified in Exhibit C as the "Shared Facilities," shall be shared among the Co-Tenants as provided in this Agreement. E. Pumpjack holds the leasehold and easement interests described on Exhibit D with respect to its Project, including with respect to the Shared Premises, and such leasehold and easement interests permit or allow access to and use of the Shared Facilities by Pumpjack. F. Pumpjack will construct, and Pumpjack, Bravo I, and Bravo II will share in the cost of, the Shared Facilities in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement. G. Each of Pumpjack, Bravo I and Bravo II is pursuing its own agreement for interconnection services with CAISO and PG&E. H. The purpose of this Agreement is to document the agreement of the Co-Tenants as to their ownership and use rights and obligations with respect to the Shared Facilities. I. The Co-Tenants also wish to provide for the appointment of a Manager for the provision of certain services with respect to the Shared Facilities, at such time and on the terms and conditions contained herein. AGREEMENT: NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants contained in this Agreement and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows: 1. DEFINITIONS 1.1 Definitions . Unless otherwise noted, capitalized terms not defined in the body of this Agreement have the following meanings. "Affiliate" means, with respect to any Party, any Person directly or indirectly controlling, controlled by or under common control with such Party. "Agreement" has the meaning set forth in the preamble above. "Agreement Date" has the meaning set forth in the preamble above. "Annual Shared Facilities Operating Plan and Budget" has the meaning set forth in Section 8.7. "Assumed Liabilities" has the meaning set forth in Section 2.7. "Bill of Sale - Shared Facilities" has the meaning set forth in Section 2.11. "Books and Records" has the meaning set forth in Section 2.5.7. "Bravo I" has the meaning set forth in the preamble above. "Bravo II" has the meaning set forth in the preamble above. "Bravo I Interconnection Agreement" has the meaning set forth in Section 2.9.4 "Bravo II Interconnection Agreement" has the meaning set forth in Section 2.9.4. "Bravo I Project" has the meaning set forth in the Recitals to this Agreement. "Bravo II Project" has the meaning set forth in the Recitals to this Agreement. "Business Day" means any day other than Saturday, Sunday or any federal holiday. "Buyer" means Bravo I or Bravo II prior to the Closing with respect to any purchase of an Undivided Interest by such Party, provided that such Party has not ceased to be a Party in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement. "Buyer Material Adverse Effect" means, with respect to a Buyer, any change that, individually or in the aggregate with other such changes, has, or reasonably would be expected to have, a material adverse effect on (i) the ability of such Buyer to perform its obligations under this Agreement, (ii) the validity or enforceability of this Agreement with respect to such Buyer, or (iii) the business, assets, operations, performance or condition (financial or otherwise) of such Buyer, other than, in the case of this clause (iii), (A) any change resulting from changes in the international, national, regional or local wholesale or retail markets for electricity, except to the extent that such change has a disproportionate effect on such Buyer, or (B) any change resulting from changes in the North American, national, regional or local electricity transmission systems, except to the extent that such change has a disproportionate effect on such Buyer. "Buyer Required Regulatory Approvals" means that (i) the applicable Buyer's Project is a Qualifying Facility, (ii) if, and to the extent necessary, FERC has (A) accepted this Agreement for filing under Section 205 of the Federal Power Act without imposing any condition that any Party considers unacceptable in its reasonable discretion, and (B) granted the Parties' request for waivers from the standards of conduct, and from maintaining an open access transmission tariff and an open access same-time information system, each without imposing any condition that any Party considers unacceptable in its reasonable discretion; and (iii) if, and to the extent necessary, FERC has authorized the transfer of an Undivided Interest in the Shared Facilities to Buyer in accordance with Section 203 of the Federal Power Act. "CAISO" has the meaning set forth in the Recitals to this Agreement. "Casualty Event" means an event that causes all or a portion of the Shared Facilities to be damaged, destroyed or rendered unfit for normal use for any reason whatsoever. "Change of Control" means the acquisition of ownership, directly or indirectly, beneficially or of record, in a transaction or series of transactions, of the membership interests or other equity securities of a Party, by any Person other than an Affiliate of such Party, representing more than 50% of either the aggregate voting power or the aggregate equity value represented by the issued and outstanding equity securities in that Party, including pursuant to a merger, consolidation, or reorganization. "Closing" has the meaning set forth in Section 2.12. "Closing Date" has the meaning set forth in Section 2.12. "Condemnation Event" means any compulsory transfer or taking or transfer under threat of compulsory transfer or taking of all or a material part of the Shared Facilities by any Governmental Authority or entity acting under power of eminent domain. "Conditional Use Permit" means that conditional use permit issued by Kern County, California, on February 28, 2013 for the Pumpjack Project (CUP Case No. 5, Map No. 97), as amended from time to time. "Confidential Information", with respect to a given Disclosing Party and the respective Receiving Party, means, collectively and individually, all data, materials and information (including software, data, technology, know-how, trade secrets, processes, ideas, inventions (whether patentable or not), prototypes, schematics, design plans, drawings, pricing information, customer and service provider lists, business arrangements, business information, financial information, financial results, technical information, analyses, forecasts, compilations, studies, contracts, agreements, and planning or strategy information) provided by or on behalf of a Party (each Party in such capacity, a "Disclosing Party") to the other Party (each Party in such capacity, a "Receiving Party") or the Receiving Party's Representatives, or to which the Receiving Party or the Receiving Party's Representatives are given access by or on behalf of the Disclosing Party, whether verbally or in written or electronic form, related to the Disclosing Party, any of the Projects, the Shared Facilities, or the Parties in connection with this Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Confidential Information under this Agreement does not include any information that: (a) is now publicly available, or that later becomes publicly available through no action by the Receiving Party or the Receiving Party's Representatives in violation of this Agreement; (b) is already in the possession of the Receiving Party or the Receiving Party's Representatives and is not, to Receiving Party's knowledge, subject to a confidentiality or fiduciary obligation at the time of the information's disclosure under this Agreement; (c) is lawfully received from any source other than the Disclosing Party or the Disclosing Party's Representatives under circumstances not involving, to the Receiving Party's knowledge, a breach of any fiduciary or confidentiality obligation; or (d) is independently developed by or for the Receiving Party or the Receiving Party's Representatives without reference to, or the use of, any portion of the Confidential Information. "Consent and Amendment" means any Consent and Amendment between SCE and Pumpjack, in form and substance reasonably acceptable to Pumpjack, in which SCE grants any required consent to this Agreement. "Consequential Damages" means lost profits or any other special, indirect or consequential damages of any nature. "Constructing Buyer/Co-Tenant" means any Buyer that (i) (a) has either delivered its Election Notice but has not yet become a Co-Tenant, or (b) is a Co-Tenant, and (ii) is constructing or installing such Buyer's or Co-Tenant's Project Interconnection Facilities or Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment. "Co-Tenants" means, as of the Agreement Date, Pumpjack and, as of the Closing with respect to any purchase of an Undivided Interest by a Co-Tenant, such Co-Tenant, provided that such Party has not ceased to be a Co-Tenant in accordance with Section 6.14. "Default Rate" means a rate per annum equal to the lesser of (a) a varying rate per annum equal to the sum of (i) the three-month LIBOR as published in The Wall Street Journal, with adjustments in that varying rate to be made on the same date as any change in that rate is so published, plus (ii) three percent per annum, and (b) the maximum rate permitted by Law. "Disclosing Party" has the meaning set forth in the definition of "Confidential Information." "Dispute" means any controversy, claim or dispute that arises out of or in connection with this Agreement or the construction, interpretation, performance, breach, termination, enforceability or validity of this Agreement, whether the same is based on rights, privileges or interests recognized by or based upon statute, contract, agreement (whether written or oral), tort, common law or other Law. "Effective Date" has the meaning set forth in Section 2.1. "Election Notice" has the meaning set forth in Section 2.4. "Emergency" shall mean any occurrence that, in the reasonable judgment of Manager or a Co-Tenant (as the case may be), requires immediate action in order to prevent or mitigate serious actual or potential hazard to the safety of Persons or property, or material interference with the safe, economical or environmentally sound operation of the Shared Facilities or any of the Projects, or violation of any applicable Law or Governmental Approval or any directive by a Governmental Authority or CAISO. "Environmental Laws" means all Laws, whenever enacted or in effect concerning pollution, protection of human health, safety or the environment or preservation or reclamation of natural resources (including endangered or threatened species), or relating to the use, storage, disposal, generation and transportation of Hazardous Substances or imposing liability for injury to human health, property or the environment. "Event of Default" has the meaning set forth in Section 14.1. "Excluded Assets" has the meaning set forth in Section 2.6. "FERC" means the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission or its successor agency. "Financing Party" means any Person providing direct or indirect debt or equity financing, refinancing or extending credit (including any financing lease) to a Co-Tenant. "Force Majeure" means acts of God or any other casualty or occurrence, condition, event or circumstance of any kind or nature not reasonably within the affected Party's control and which could not have been avoided by reasonable measures by the affected Party, including strikes, slow-downs or labor difficulties, fires, flood, earthquakes, explosions, natural disasters, or other hazards, equipment failure where such equipment has been maintained in accordance with Prudent Utility Practices, acts of public enemies, riots, civil commotions, insurrection, or war. Force Majeure expressly does not include: any delay in performing or failure of performance of any contractual provision by a Party (except to the extent caused by a Force Majeure event); late delivery of equipment or materials (except to the extent caused by a Force Majeure event); or economic hardship. "Governmental Approval" means any permit, license, certificate, concession, approval, consent, ratification, permission, clearance, confirmation, exemption, waiver, franchise, certification, designation, rating, registration, variance, qualification, accreditation or authorization issued, granted, given or otherwise made available by or under the authority of any Governmental Authority or pursuant to any Law. "Governmental Authority" means any court, tribunal, authority, agency, commission, official or other instrumentality, including regulatory authorities and bodies, of the United States or any state, county, city or other political subdivision, any quasi-governmental regulatory authority, such as NERC or its regional reliability organizations acting under delegated authority, arbitrator or any judicial or quasi judicial tribunal of competent jurisdiction. "Hazardous Substances" means: (a) any hazardous materials, hazardous wastes, hazardous substances, toxic wastes, solid wastes, and toxic substances as those or similar terms are defined under any Environmental Laws; (b) any asbestos or asbestos containing material; (c) polychlorinated biphenyls ("PCBs"), or PCB containing materials or fluids; (d) radon; (e) any petroleum, petroleum hydrocarbons, petroleum products, crude oil and any fractions or derivatives thereof; and (f) any other hazardous, radioactive, toxic or noxious substance, material, pollutant, or contaminant that, whether by its nature or its use, or exposure to is subject to regulation or could give rise to liability under any Environmental Laws. "Indemnified Parties" has the meaning set forth in Section 11.6. "Interconnection Agreement" means the Pumpjack Interconnection Agreement, the Bravo I Interconnection Agreement, or the Bravo II Interconnection Agreement, as applicable. "Laws" means any applicable constitutional provisions, statutes, acts, codes, laws, rules, regulations, ordinances, orders, decrees, rulings, judgments or decisions of a Governmental Authority or arbitral body. "Liabilities" means any and all claims, actions, debts, losses, liabilities, damages, expenses, awards, judgments, settlement payments, fines, penalties, costs, royalties, assessments (tax or otherwise), proceedings, deficiencies or obligations, whether civil or criminal, including those arising out of any investigation, action, claim, settlement, compromise, judgment or award, by any Person, of any nature, including for personal injury, death or damage to real property and tangible personal property of or to any Party or any third party, whether known or unknown, absolute, accrued, contingent or otherwise and whether due or to become due, and whether or not resulting from third party claims, and any out-of-pocket costs and expenses (including court costs and fees, reasonable legal counsels', accountants', or other fees and expenses) incurred in defending against or investigating any of the same. "Liens" means all mortgages, deeds of trust, liens, debentures, security interests, pledges, conditional sale contracts, proceedings, judgment liens, orders, rights of first refusal, charges and other encumbrances or restrictions of any kind, whether recorded or unrecorded. "Loss Event" means a Casualty Event or a Condemnation Event. "Lost Production Damages" means the total payment lost for products (including energy, green attributes, capacity or other products) sold under the relevant Project Offtake Agreement not generated and delivered, any resource adequacy or availability incentive or bonus payments lost, and any resource adequacy deficit payment charges, minimum energy delivery obligation charges, or other penalties, costs or charges incurred, by a Co-Tenant under any Project Offtake Agreement, the CAISO open access transmission tariff or otherwise, as a direct result of any interruptions or curtailments of output from its Project. "Lost Tax Benefits Value" means, with respect to any reduced or lost energy production, the amount, in dollars, equal to the Tax Benefits to which a Co-Tenant, its partners, members, Affiliates or tax investors would have been entitled with respect to the amount of energy production reduced or lost, and a gross up amount (calculated using the highest marginal U.S. and state income tax rates then applicable to domestic corporations) to take into account the federal and state corporate income tax to the Co-Tenant or its partners, members, Affiliates or tax investors on the payment of the amount set forth above in lieu of the Tax Benefits. "Major Decisions" means: (a) any sale, lease, or other voluntary disposition of the Shared Facilities, other than a Transfer in accordance with the requirements of Section 17.1; (b) any encumbrance or grant of any Lien on the Shared Facilities (other than any Permitted Lien); (c) any action (including amending, failing to obtain or, as a result of the breach of its terms, causing the revocation of, any Governmental Approval required for the operation, ownership, management or maintenance of the Shared Facilities or the transmission of electric energy on the Shared Facilities) that would materially and adversely change or impact the regulatory status of any Co-Tenant or the Shared Facilities; (d) any material capital expenditures, except in an Emergency; or (e) any action that would materially and adversely impact any Co-Tenant's interest in the Shared Facilities or a Buyer's Option right. "Majority Vote" means a decision by Co-Tenants holding greater than fifty percent (50%) of the Percentage Interest in the Shared Facilities. "Manager" has the meaning set forth in the preamble above. "Manager Representative" has the meaning set forth in Section 8.13. "NERC" means the North American Electric Reliability Corporation, or any successor thereto, and any regional entity to which NERC delegates its authority as the Electric Reliability Organization under Section 215 of the Federal Power Act. "Net Production Losses" means any applicable Lost Tax Benefits Value and any applicable Lost Production Damages. "Network Upgrades" has the meaning set forth in the Pumpjack Interconnection Agreement, the Bravo I Interconnection Agreement, or Bravo II Interconnection Agreement, as applicable. "Option" has the meaning set forth in Section 2.2. "Option Deadline" means December 31, 2020. "Option Premium" means the amount of One Dollar ($1.00). "Participating TO" means, with respect to any Co-Tenant, the "Participating TO" as identified in such Co-Tenant's Interconnection Agreement. "Parties" and "Party" have the respective meanings set forth in the preamble above. "PCBs" has the meaning set forth in the definition of "Hazardous Substances." "Percentage Interest" means, with respect to each Co-Tenant, the percentage as set forth on Exhibit E to this Agreement. "Permitted Liens" means: (a) Liens for taxes that (i) are not yet delinquent or (ii) are being contested in good faith by appropriate proceedings, so long as any such proceeding does not involve any substantial danger of the sale, forfeiture or loss of any part of the Shared Facilities; (b) Liens in favor of carriers, warehousemen, mechanics, materialmen, repairmen or other like Liens that (i) arise in the ordinary course of business of and for amounts that are not yet due, or (ii) are being contested in good faith by appropriate proceedings, so long as any such proceeding does not involve any substantial danger of the sale, forfeiture or loss of any part of the Shared Facilities; or (c) Liens in favor of Financing Parties permitted pursuant to Section 17.2.1. "Person" means any individual, partnership, joint stock company, corporation, limited liability company, trust, unincorporated association or joint venture, any Governmental Authority, or any other entity. "PG&E" has the meaning given in the Recitals to this Agreement. "Point of Common Coupling" is "the point of common coupling" as identified in Exhibit C to this Agreement. "Project" means the Pumpjack Project, the Bravo I Project; or the Bravo II Project, as applicable. "Project Interconnection Facilities" mean, with respect to each Co-Tenant, the facilities of such Co-Tenant (the planned location of which, as of the Agreement Date, is shown on Exhibit A) that interconnect such Co-Tenant's Project with and into the Shared Facilities. "Project Offtake Agreement" means, with respect to any Project, any agreement for the sale and purchase of energy, capacity, resource attributes, green attributes, or other products or services from such Project. "Project Site" means the real property on which the applicable Project is located. "Project Specific Assets" means, with respect to each Co-Tenant's Project, any of the assets comprising such Project, the Project Site underlying such Project, the agreements and contractual arrangements related to such Project and Project Site, and such Co-Tenant's Project Interconnection Facilities. For the avoidance of doubt, the Project Specific Assets shall not include any of the Shared Facilities. "Prudent Industry Practices" means any of the practices, methods, and standards of care, skill, safety and diligence, as the same may change from time to time, but applied in light of the facts known at the time, as are generally applied or utilized under comparable circumstances by reasonably experienced and prudent professionals in respect of the design, development, construction, commissioning, maintenance, financing and operation of electric generating facilities and electric transmission facilities located in the United States of America of comparable type and complexity to the Projects and the Shared Facilities. "Prudent Industry Practices" do not necessarily mean the best practice, method, or standard of care, skill, safety and diligence in all cases, but is instead intended to encompass a range of acceptable practices, methods, and standards. "Pumpjack Consent" means the consent by Pumpjack to the Substation Easement Agreement, in the form attached hereto as Exhibit F-1. "Pumpjack Interconnection Agreement" means the Small Generator Interconnection Agreement (CAISO Queue Position No. 653B) among Pumpjack, PG&E, and CAISO, dated April 25, 2013, for 20 MW of interconnection service, as amended or restated. "Pumpjack Lease and Easement" means the Lease and Easement Agreement between Pumpjack, as Tenant, and Starrh & Starrh Cotton Growers, LP, as Owner, dated August 12, 2011, as described on Exhibit D to this Agreement. "Pumpjack Material Adverse Effect" means, with respect to Pumpjack, the Shared Facilities, or the Shared Premises, any change that, individually or in the aggregate with other such changes, has, or reasonably would be expected to have, a material adverse effect on (i) the ability of Pumpjack to perform its obligations under this Agreement, (ii) the validity or enforceability of this Agreement with respect to Pumpjack, or (iii) the business, assets, operations, performance or condition (financial or otherwise) of Pumpjack, the Shared Facilities, or the Shared Premises, other than, in the case of this clause (iii), (A) any change resulting from changes in the international, national, regional or local wholesale or retail markets for electricity, except to the extent that such change has a disproportionate effect on Pumpjack or the Shared Facilities, or (B) any change resulting from changes in the North American, national, regional or local electricity transmission systems, except to the extent that such change has a disproportionate effect on Pumpjack, the Shared Facilities, or the Shared Premises, or (C) any materially adverse change in the Shared Facilities or the Shared Premises which is cured (including by payment of money) by Pumpjack before the applicable Closing. "Pumpjack Project" has the meaning set forth in the Recitals to this Agreement. "Pumpjack Required Regulatory Approvals" means that (i) the applicable Buyer's Project is a Qualifying Facility, (ii) if, and to the extent necessary, FERC has (A) accepted this Agreement for filing under Section 205 of the Federal Power Act without imposing any condition that any Party considers unacceptable in its reasonable discretion, and (B) granted the Parties' request for waivers from the standards of conduct, and from maintaining an open access transmission tariff and an open access same-time information system, each without imposing any condition that any Party considers unacceptable in its reasonable discretion; and (iii) if, and to the extent necessary, FERC has authorized the transfer of an Undivided Interest in the Shared Facilities to Buyer in accordance with Section 203 of the Federal Power Act. "Purchase Price" has the meaning set forth in Section 2.8. "Qualifying Facility" means a "small power production facility" with a power production capacity of 20 MW or less, net at the point of delivery, as defined in the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act of 1978 and FERC's implementing regulations at 18 C.F.R. part 292. "Receiving Party" has the meaning set forth in the definition of "Confidential Information." "Removal Costs" means any costs, expenses or other Liabilities associated with the decommissioning or removal of the Shared Facilities upon the cessation of operations of the Projects. "Representatives" means, with respect to a Party, such Party's Affiliates, officers, directors, managers, members, shareholders, partners, employees, lenders (actual or prospective), investors (actual or prospective), transferees of Undivided Interests (actual or prospective), purchasers (actual or prospective), contractors, vendors, suppliers, advisors, consultants, agents and representatives. "Restoration Proposal" has the meaning set forth in Section 8.12.2. "SCE" means Southern California Edison Company, a California corporation. "Scheduled Outage" means a time period during which any of the Shared Facilities major equipment is shut down for maintenance as scheduled in the Annual Shared Facilities Operating Plan and Budget or otherwise agreed upon by the Parties. Such maintenance will be scheduled and performed based on taking into consideration the requirements of manufacturers' warranties and recommendations and Prudent Industry Practices. "Shared Expenses" means costs, expenses and other Liabilities arising under or relating to the Shared Facilities or Shared Premises, including any costs, expenses and other Liabilities of the Manager or its Affiliates attributable to the performance of Manager's duties as Manager, but excluding (a) the cost and expense of any Project Specific Assets and the connection and integration of Project Specific Assets with any Shared Facilities (including any design, procurement, construction, or installation costs); (b) any costs and expenses to restore or repair the Shared Facilities arising from a Co-Tenant's actions or inactions in violation of this Agreement or a Governmental Approval, (c) any costs or expenses incurred in connection with Section 4.1, (d) the cost and expense of any Participating TO Interconnection Facilities or Network Upgrades required to connect and integrate any Project Specific Assets with the transmission system, or (e) the costs and expenses related to the Shared Facilities and Shared Premises permit obligations retained by Pumpjack as set forth in Section 2.5.4. "Shared Facilities" means the facilities identified as "Shared Facilities" on Exhibit C to this Agreement. The "Shared Facilities" shall include the Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment and the Shared Telecommunications Equipment but shall not include (i) any equipment, or interconnection or collection facilities, between any Project and the Point of Common Coupling; (ii) any Participating TO Interconnection Facilities or Network Upgrades funded by Pumpjack under the Pumpjack Interconnection Agreement, by Bravo I under the Bravo I Interconnection Agreement, or by Bravo II under the Bravo II Interconnection Agreement, or (iii) the Shared Premises or the Substation Easement Agreement. "Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment" means the common gen-tie circuit breaker and the common disconnect switch identified on Exhibit C to this Agreement and any other equipment that may be required by PG&E, or that may otherwise reasonably be required, to accommodate the interconnection of any Co-Tenant's Project Interconnection Facilities with the Shared Facilities (excluding for this purpose the Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment) and the use by such Co-Tenant of the Shared Facilities (excluding for this purpose the Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment) in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement. "Shared Facilities Representative" has the meaning set forth in Section 5.2. "Shared Premises" means the land described on Exhibit B to this Agreement. "Shared Premises Easement" means, with respect to either Bravo I or Bravo II, non-exclusive easements for access to and use of the Shared Premises, as granted by the Shared Premises Landowner to Bravo I or Bravo II, in the form of the Substation Easement Agreement and subject to the Pumpjack Consent, on the terms and subject to the conditions of such Co-Tenant's Substation Easement Agreement. "Shared Premises Landowner" means the Lessor under the Pumpjack Lease and Easement. "Shared Telecommunications Equipment" means the telecommunications circuits required under the Pumpjack Interconnection Agreement and as described in the PG&E Transmission Interconnection Handbook as in effect on the Agreement Date and as amended thereafter during the term of this Agreement; provided, however, that such telecommunications circuits shall be "Shared Telecommunications Equipment" with respect to any Buyer or Co-Tenant only if and to the extent that all or any portion of such circuits are reasonably capable of being used by such Buyer or Co-Tenant in connection with its use of the other Shared Facilities in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement. "Substation Easement Agreement" means the easement agreement granted by the Shared Premises Landowner to Bravo I or Bravo II in the form attached hereto as Exhibit F. "Tax Benefits" means any federal or state tax credits, or cash grants, production incentives, or similar tax cash benefits associated with the renewable energy generated from the Projects. "Temporary Construction Easement" has the meaning set forth in Section 3.5.3. "Termination Event" has the meaning set forth in Section 17.3. "Transfer" means to grant, sell, assign, set over, deliver, convey, demise, dispose of or otherwise transfer an interest in tangible or intangible assets or in any rights or interests under this Agreement. "Undivided Interest" has the meaning set forth in Section 3.2.1. "Warranty Rights" has the meaning set forth in Section 2.5.6. "Withdrawal Date" has the meaning set forth in Section 6.14.1. "Withdrawal Notice" has the meaning set forth in Section 6.14.1. 2. TERM, GRANT OF OPTION; EXERCISE OF OPTION; PURCHASE PRICE; CONDITIONS PRECEDENT TO CLOSING; CLOSING OF PURCHASE AND SALE 2.1 Effective Date . The effectiveness of this Agreement is conditioned upon the execution and delivery by SCE and Pumpjack of the Consent and Amendment. This Agreement will become effective on the date on which the condition set forth in the immediately preceding sentence has been satisfied (the "Effective Date"). Subject to the foregoing, the term of this Agreement will commence on the Effective Date and remain in full force and effect following the Effective Date until the first to occur of (a) the mutual agreement of all the Parties to terminate this Agreement, or (b) termination of this Agreement as otherwise provided in this Agreement. 2.2 Grant of Option . Upon the terms and subject to the conditions contained in this Agreement, Pumpjack hereby grants to (i) Bravo I an exclusive and irrevocable option, exercisable in Bravo I's sole and exclusive discretion, to purchase an Undivided Interest in a percentage amount equal to Bravo I's Percentage Interest and no less than Bravo I's Percentage Interest, and (ii) Bravo II an exclusive and irrevocable option, exercisable in Bravo II's sole and exclusive discretion, to purchase an Undivided Interest in a percentage amount equal to Bravo II's Percentage Interest and no less than Bravo II's Percentage Interest (such options are hereinafter referred to individually as an "Option" and collectively as the "Options"). For avoidance of doubt, after exercise of all of the Options described in this Section 2.2, Pumpjack would retain for itself an Undivided Interest in a percentage amount equal to Pumpjack's Percentage Interest. 2.3 Option Premium . For and in consideration for the grant of the Option to such Buyer by Pumpjack and the continuing maintenance by Pumpjack of such Option in full force and effect in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement, each Buyer hereby agrees to pay the Option Premium to Pumpjack on the Effective Date. 2.4 Exercise of Option . Subject to the conditions contained in this Agreement, a Buyer may exercise its Option in whole only and not in part. Each Buyer shall be entitled to exercise its respective Option at any time prior to the Option Deadline by delivery to Pumpjack of written notice of its election to exercise the Option (the "Election Notice"). Any Option that is not exercised prior to the Option Deadline shall be extinguished and of no further force or effect effective upon and after the Option Deadline. 2.5 Purchase and Sale . In the event a Buyer exercises its Option, Pumpjack shall sell, convey, assign, transfer and deliver to such Buyer an Undivided Interest in the full amount of the Percentage Interest subject to such Option under Section 2.2, on the terms and subject to the conditions contained in this Agreement. As of the time of any Closing, the Shared Facilities shall include the following assets but not the Excluded Assets: 2.5.1 Tangible Personal Property . All tangible personal property included in the Shared Facilities. 2.5.2 Supplies . The inventories of spare parts, lubricants and other fluids intended to be consumed at the Shared Facilities in the ordinary course of business, maintenance, shop and office materials and supplies, and other similar tangible personal property on hand at or in transit to the Shared Facilities as of the Closing and intended to be consumed at the Shared Facilities in the ordinary course of business. 2.5.3 Shared Facilities Contracts . All material contracts, agreements and personal property leases that are used in, relate primarily to or are necessary for the ownership or operation of the Shared Facilities, except for the Pumpjack Interconnection Agreement, the Bravo I Interconnection Agreement, and Bravo II Interconnection Agreement and other agreements of a respective Party which will be separately entered into with CAISO or such Party's Participating TO, including participating generator agreements and meter service agreements. 2.5.4 Shared Facilities Permits . All material permits that are used in, related primarily to or are necessary for the ownership or operation of the Shared Facilities; provided, however, that, notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, Pumpjack, at its own expense, shall be obligated to comply with all compliance and mitigation obligations of the Conditional Use Permit and other material permits related primarily to or necessary for the ownership or operation of Pumpjack's Project or Pumpjack's Project Interconnection Facilities. 2.5.5 Intangible Personal Property . All material intellectual property and all other intangible proprietary information or materials owned by or licensed to Pumpjack and necessary for the ownership or operation of the Shared Facilities. 2.5.6 Warranties . All warranties that are unexpired as of the Closing that relate specifically to the Shared Facilities (the "Warranty Rights"). 2.5.7 Books and Records . All books and records used in, relating primarily to or necessary for the ownership or operation of the Shared Facilities (the "Books and Records"). 2.5.8 Incidental Assets . All of the following, insofar as the same are used in, related primarily to or are necessary for the ownership or operation of the Shared Facilities: (i) all purchase orders and certificates of title and documents; and (ii) all keys, lock combinations, computer access codes and other devices or information necessary to gain entry to or take possession of the Shared Facilities. 2.6 Excluded Assets . With respect to any Undivided Interest purchased by a Buyer, the Shared Facilities shall not include any of the following assets of Pumpjack (the "Excluded Assets"): 2.6.1 Claims; Other Rights of Recovery . All claims, causes of action, rights of recovery, rights of set-off, rights to refunds and similar rights of any kind in favor of Pumpjack or any other Person arising from or relating to the operation of the Shared Facilities with respect to any period of time prior to the Closing of the purchase of such Undivided Interest, including any refund of taxes described in Section 2.6.2 immediately below, except for (i) any of the foregoing that relate to Assumed Liabilities and (ii) the Warranty Rights. 2.6.2 Tax Refunds . All refunds or credits, if any, of taxes due to or from Pumpjack or any other Person, excluding any refunds or credits to the extent attributable to taxes on or with respect to such Buyer's Undivided Interest that were imposed for a period (or portion thereof) beginning after the Closing of the purchase of such Undivided Interest. 2.6.3 Insurance . The rights under any insurance policy arising out of and relating to events or periods prior to the Closing of the purchase of such Undivided Interest or which is not related to the Shared Facilities, except to the extent such policy insures for events or occurrences that are included in the Assumed Liabilities. 2.6.4 Corporate Records . All books and records of Pumpjack or any other Person other than the Books and Records. 2.7 Assumed Liabilities . At the Closing with respect to any purchase of an Undivided Interest by a Buyer, such Buyer shall assume and agree to pay, perform and discharge when due, in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement, such Buyer's Percentage Interest share of all Liabilities related to the Shared Facilities or the ownership, possession, occupancy, or use thereof, in each case arising or to be performed on or after the Closing (the "Assumed Liabilities"). For the avoidance of doubt, the Assumed Liabilities shall include the following: 2.7.1 Obligations in Respect of Shared Facilities . All Liabilities in respect of the ownership, possession, occupancy, development, construction, improvement, maintenance, repair, use or operation of the Shared Facilities, in each case arising or to be performed on or after the Closing. 2.7.2 Liabilities Under Shared Facilities Contracts and Shared Facilities Permits . All Liabilities under the Shared Facilities contracts (excluding those contracts expressly excluded pursuant to Section 2.5.4) and Shared Facilities permits arising or to be performed on or after the Closing (excluding those obligations excluded pursuant to Section 2.5.5). 2.7.3 Taxes . All taxes related to the Shared Facilities or the ownership, possession, occupancy or use thereof, attributable to any period from and after the Closing. 2.8 Purchase Price . The purchase price (the "Purchase Price") of an Undivided Interest in the Shared Facilities shall be One Dollar ($1.00). The Purchase Price shall be payable to Pumpjack in cash in U.S. dollars. 2.9 Conditions to Obligations of Pumpjack . The obligations of Pumpjack hereunder to sell an Undivided Interest to a Buyer are subject to the fulfillment, at or before the Closing of such sale, of each of the following conditions (all or any of which may be waived in whole or in part by Pumpjack in its sole discretion): 2.9.1 Performance . Such Buyer shall have performed and complied with, in all material respects, the agreements, covenants and obligations required by this Agreement to be so performed or complied with by such Buyer at or before the Closing. 2.9.2 Orders and Laws . There shall not be in effect on the Closing Date any Law restraining, enjoining or otherwise prohibiting or making illegal the consummation of the sale of the Undivided Interest to such Buyer or any of the other transactions contemplated by this Agreement. 2.9.3 Consents and Approvals . All consents, approvals and actions of, filings with and notices to any Governmental Authority or any other Person (but not including any consents, approvals or actions of any Financing Party) necessary to permit Pumpjack and Buyer to perform their obligations under this Agreement, and to consummate the transactions contemplated hereby and thereby (including the Pumpjack Required Regulatory Approvals and Buyer Required Regulatory Approvals, together with the consent referenced in Section 2.9.6 below), shall have been duly obtained, made or given and shall be in full force and effect, and all terminations or expirations of waiting periods imposed by any Governmental Authority necessary for the consummation of the transactions contemplated by this Agreement a shall have occurred. 2.9.4 Interconnection Agreements . Such Buyer shall have entered into a fully executed interconnection agreement or agreements as contemplated in Section 6.4 (any such agreement, as the case may be, the "Bravo I Interconnection Agreement" or "Bravo II Interconnection Agreement"); 2.9.5 CAISO Revenue Meter . Such Buyer shall have confirmed that its Project includes a dedicated CAISO revenue meter that is capable of accurately measuring such Project's generation output and station power usage. 2.9.6 Shared Premises Easement 2.9.7 . The Shared Premises Landowner shall have granted a Shared Premises Easement to the applicable Buyer on the terms and subject to the conditions of the Substation Easement Agreement and Pumpjack Consent. 2.9.7 Amendment of Pumpjack Interconnection Agreement. Either (a) PG&E and CAISO shall have determined that no amendment to the Pumpjack Interconnection Agreement is required as a result of or in connection with this Agreement, or (b) PG&E, CAISO and Pumpjack shall have entered into such an amendment on terms and conditions reasonably acceptable to Pumpjack. 2.9.8 No Buyer Material Adverse Effect . There shall not have occurred and be continuing with respect to such Buyer any Buyer Material Adverse Effect. 2.9.9 Deliveries . Such Buyer shall have executed and delivered to Pumpjack all other agreements, instruments and documents required to be delivered by the Buyer under Section 2.12.2. 2.10 Conditions to Obligations of Buyer . The obligations of a Buyer hereunder to purchase an Undivided Interest from Pumpjack are subject to the fulfillment, at or before the Closing of such purchase, of each of the following conditions (all or any of which may be waived in whole or in part by Buyer in its sole discretion): 2.10.1 Performance . Pumpjack shall have performed and complied with, in all material respects, the agreements, covenants and obligations required by this Agreement to be so performed or complied with by Pumpjack at or before the Closing. 2.10.2 Orders and Laws . There shall not be in effect on the date of such Closing any order or Law restraining, enjoining or otherwise prohibiting or making illegal the consummation of any of the transactions contemplated by this Agreement. 2.10.3 Consents and Approvals . All consents, approvals and actions of, filings with and notices to any Governmental Authority or any other Person (but not including any consents, approvals or actions of any Financing Party) necessary to permit the Buyer and Pumpjack to perform their obligations under this Agreement, and to consummate the transactions contemplated hereby and thereby (including the Pumpjack Required Regulatory Approvals and Buyer Required Regulatory Approvals), shall have been duly obtained, made or given and shall be in full force and effect, and all terminations or expirations of waiting periods imposed by any Governmental Authority necessary for the consummation of the transactions contemplated by this Agreement shall have occurred. 2.10.4 No Pumpjack Material Adverse Effect . There shall not have occurred and be continuing any Pumpjack Material Adverse Effect. 2.10.5 Deliveries . Pumpjack shall have executed and delivered to the Buyer all other agreements, instruments and documents required to be delivered by Pumpjack under Section 2.12.1. 2.10.6 Absence of Liens . There shall be no Liens on any portion of the Shared Facilities (other than Permitted Liens) unless and to the extent that Pumpjack is reasonably and in good faith contesting such Liens. 2.11 Certain Closing Deliveries . Effective upon the Closing of the purchase of an Undivided Interest under this Agreement, Pumpjack shall (a) subject to satisfaction of the condition set forth in Section 2.9.6, execute and deliver to the applicable Buyer the Pumpjack Consent in the form attached hereto as Exhibit F-1, and (b) execute and deliver to the applicable Buyer a Bill of Sale - Shared Facilities in the form attached as Exhibit G (the "Bill of Sale - Shared Facilities") pursuant to which Pumpjack shall transfer to such Buyer an undivided interest equal to the Undivided Interest in and to the particular Shared Facilities that constitute personal property. 2.12 Closing . The closing of each purchase and sale of an Undivided Interest (each, a "Closing") shall be held at such time and place as Pumpjack and the applicable Buyer may agree in writing, on the third Business Day after the conditions in Section 2.9 and Section 2.10 are either satisfied or waived by the Party entitled to waive such conditions, or on such other date as Pumpjack and the Buyer may agree in writing. The date on which the Closing actually occurs is referred to in this Agreement as the "Closing Date". Upon satisfaction or waiver of all of the conditions to a Party's obligations to complete the transactions contemplated by this Agreement, such Party shall notify the other Party thereof as promptly as possible thereafter. 2.12.1 Pumpjack's Closing Deliveries . At the Closing with respect to any purchase of an Undivided Interest by a Buyer, Pumpjack shall deliver to such Buyer, or cause to be delivered to such Buyer, the following: (a) Such Buyer's Pumpjack Consent (subject to satisfaction of the condition set forth in Section 2.9.6) and Bill of Sale - Shared Facilities, as executed on behalf of Pumpjack; (b) copies of any and all consents, waivers, authorizations or approvals, including the Pumpjack Required Regulatory Approvals, obtained by Pumpjack from Governmental Authorities or other third Persons with respect to the sale of the Undivided Interest or the consummation of the transactions contemplated by this Agreement; (c) a statement, in a form reasonably satisfactory to such Buyer, certifying that withholding is not required by the Buyer under Code Section 1445 or the Treasury Regulations thereunder; and (d) any other documents or instruments reasonably required by such Buyer to consummate the transactions contemplated hereunder. 2.12.2 Buyer's Closing Deliveries . At the Closing with respect to any purchase of an Undivided Interest by a Buyer, such Buyer shall deliver to Pumpjack, or cause to be delivered to Pumpjack, the following: (a) the Purchase Price as provided in Section 2.8 and any payment due for Shared Telecommunications Equipment pursuant to Section 3.5.2, if applicable, in each case in immediately available United States funds; (b) subject to satisfaction of the condition set forth in Section 2.9.6, such Buyer's Pumpjack Consent, as executed on behalf of Buyer; (c) copies of any and all consents, waivers, authorizations or approvals, including the Buyer Required Regulatory Approvals, obtained by such Buyer from Governmental Authorities or other third Persons with respect to the purchase of the Undivided Interest or the consummation of the transactions contemplated by this Agreement; and (d) any other documents or instruments reasonably required by Pumpjack to consummate the transaction contemplated hereunder. 2.13 Use Rights . Pumpjack's conveyance to a Buyer of an Undivided Interest shall expressly include the right to use, subject to the terms and conditions provided in this Agreement, a Percentage Interest in the Shared Facilities that corresponds to such Undivided Interest. 2.14 Status as Co-Tenant . Effective upon the acquisition of an Undivided Interest under this Agreement, a Buyer will be deemed a Co-Tenant under this Agreement with respect to such Undivided Interest and will be entitled to exercise its Shared Facilities use rights on the terms and subject to the conditions of this Agreement. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, neither Bravo I nor Bravo II has any authority to assert the rights available to a Co-Tenant under this Agreement unless and until the occurrence of the Closing with respect to any purchase of an Undivided Interest by such Buyer. After the exercise of any or all Options, Pumpjack will remain a Co-Tenant under this Agreement with respect to its Undivided Interest and will be entitled to exercise its Shared Facilities use rights on the terms and subject to the conditions of this Agreement. 2.15 Buyer Withdrawal and Termination . Either Buyer shall, at any time prior to the exercise by such Buyer of its Option with respect to such Buyer's purchase of an Undivided Interest, have the right to withdraw as a Party from this Agreement, and in the event of any such withdrawal this Agreement shall be deemed terminated with respect to such Buyer; provided, however, that no such withdrawal or termination shall relieve any such Buyer from any Liability incurred prior to such withdrawal and termination or from any obligations that by their terms survive termination of this Agreement. 2.16 Right to Terminate in Event of Failure to Close by Outside Date . 2.16.1 This Agreement may be terminated by Pumpjack or by any Buyer, in each case solely with respect to such Buyer, by written notice from one such Party to the other such Party, on or after three hundred and sixty-five (365) days after the date of the Election Notice, if the Closing has not occurred prior to the effectiveness of such written notice of termination; provided, that Buyer cannot terminate under this provision if the failure of the Closing to occur is the result of the failure on the part of Buyer to perform any of its obligations hereunder and Pumpjack cannot terminate this Agreement under this provision if the failure of the Closing to occur is the result of the failure on the part of Pumpjack to perform any of its obligations hereunder. 2.16.2 In the event of termination of this Agreement pursuant to Section 2.16.1, the obligations of the Parties to consummate the transactions contemplated hereby shall terminate; provided, however, that if this Agreement is terminated pursuant to the provisions of Section 2.16.1 with respect to the first Buyer to provide an Election Notice, then the obligations of Pumpjack and the other Buyer shall survive such termination unless and until such time as this Agreement is terminated with respect to such other Buyer; provided, further, that no termination of this Agreement shall relieve either Party of liability for breach of this Agreement. The foregoing provisions shall not limit or restrict the availability of specific performance or other injunctive or equitable relief to the extent that specific performance or such other relief would otherwise be available to a Party hereunder. Subject to the provisions of Section 17.7, each Party's right of termination hereunder is in addition to any other rights it may have hereunder or otherwise. In the event of termination of this Agreement pursuant to Section 2.16.1, all filings, applications and other submissions made to any Governmental Authority solely with respect to such terminating Party, shall, to the extent practicable, be withdrawn from the Governmental Authority to which they were made. 3. SHARED FACILITIES 3.1 Shared Facilities . Pumpjack plans to design and construct the Shared Facilities, including the Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment subject to the terms of Section 3.5.1 below, that are governed by this Agreement. The Parties acknowledge and agree that unless and until there is any other Co-Tenant under this Agreement, Pumpjack shall be the sole Party with title to the Shared Facilities and its Percentage Interest shall be one hundred percent (100%). 3.2 Partial Conveyance of Co-Tenancy Interests in Shared Facilities . 3.2.1 Effective on the Closing with respect to any purchase of an Undivided Interest by a Buyer, upon and subject to the terms, conditions, restrictions and reservations set forth in this Agreement, Pumpjack shall be deemed to have transferred to such Buyer an undivided ownership interest in and to the Shared Facilities owned or hereafter acquired by Pumpjack, equal to such Buyer's respective Percentage Interest, AS IS, WITH ALL FAULTS AND WITHOUT (EXCEPT AS AND TO THE EXTENT OTHERWISE EXPRESSLY PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT) ANY REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES WHATSOEVER, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, AND SPECIFICALLY EXCLUDING ANY WARRANTY OF TITLE, MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR ANY OTHER WARRANTY ARISING UNDER STATUTORY OR COMMON LAW, while at the same time reserving to itself an undivided ownership interest in and to such Shared Facilities in the amount of the Pumpjack's Percentage Interest. The intent of the foregoing is that each Co-Tenant shall each own an undivided interest as a tenant in common in the Shared Facilities equal to such Co-Tenant's respective Percentage Interest so as to provide for the joint ownership of the Shared Facilities (along with all appurtenant rights) by the Co-Tenants subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement. The foregoing undivided interest of each Co-Tenant in the Shared Facilities may be referred to from time to time in this Agreement as an "Undivided Interest." 3.2.2 Without limiting the provisions of Section 2.12.1, on the Closing Date with respect to any Option exercise by a Buyer, or within a reasonable time thereafter, Pumpjack shall deliver to such Buyer any other notices, instruments, documents, agreements or consents as are reasonably necessary in connection with the ownership of Bravo I's or Bravo II's respective Undivided Interest. 3.3 Access to Shared Premises . Each Co-Tenant and its Representatives shall have access to the Shared Premises, pursuant to such Co-Tenant's Substation Easement Agreement and Pumpjack Consent, for purposes of (a) performing any required maintenance and repairs of any Project Interconnection Facilities or (b) inspecting the Shared Facilities, in each case in accordance with the provisions of Section 8.10. Without the prior written consent of Pumpjack in its sole discretion, in no event shall any Co-Tenant other than Pumpjack be permitted access to the substation control room on the Shared Premises. Except in the event of an Emergency, each Co-Tenant shall provide no less than 24 hours' prior notice to each other Co-Tenant (and the Manager) of any intent of such Co-Tenant or any of its Representatives to access the Shared Premises and the purpose of such access, and each Co-Tenant shall provide no less than 48 hours' prior notice to each other Co-Tenant (and the Manager) prior to performing any maintenance or repairs pursuant to clause (a) above. Each Co-Tenant and any Co-Tenant's Representatives shall: (i) follow all applicable safety, security and site rules established by the Manager; and (ii) comply with all applicable real estate restrictions, applicable Law and Governmental Approvals when on the Shared Premises or accessing the Shared Facilities, except to the extent that following any such rule would violate applicable Law. A Co-Tenant shall not be required to provide any such prior notice when accessing the Shared Premises to respond to and address an Emergency, but any such Co-Tenant shall provide notice of access to, and coordinate with, the Manager and the other Co-Tenant as soon as reasonably practicable thereafter. 3.4 No Interference, Cooperation; Quiet Enjoyment and Over-Burdening . Unless and until there is any other Co-Tenant under this Agreement, Pumpjack shall be the only Party that is permitted to use the Shared Facilities, unless a Governmental Authority issues an order requiring otherwise. A Co-Tenant's use of the Shared Facilities or the operation of its Project or Project Interconnection Facilities shall not be permitted to interfere with the use and enjoyment by any other Co-Tenant of its respective rights in the Shared Facilities or the operation of its Project, except as and to the extent specifically provided herein. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, including Section 6.14 below, each Co-Tenant hereby consents to the development and operation of the Projects, and each Co-Tenant shall cooperate in good faith to accommodate each other Co-Tenant's use of the Shared Facilities for the benefit of the Projects as contemplated by this Agreement. Each Co-Tenant further agrees that, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Pumpjack shall be entitled to construct on the Shared Premises any improvements and install on the Shared Premises any equipment that Pumpjack in its sole discretion determines to be appropriate. No Co-Tenant will use or permit the use of the Shared Facilities or such Co-Tenant's Shared Premises Easement in any manner that would create waste or nuisance, or that would jeopardize the issuance or maintenance of any insurance policy relating to the Shared Facilities, such Co-Tenant's Shared Premises Easement, or any Governmental Approval as to the Shared Facilities, such Co-Tenant's Shared Premises Easement, or any Project, nor otherwise conduct or permit to be conducted operations on its Project Site which would have similar effects on, or otherwise damage or interfere with, the Shared Facilities or such Co-Tenant's Shared Premises Easement. All costs and expenses associated with a Co-Tenant's Project Specific Assets shall be for the account of, and paid for, by such Co-Tenant. 3.5 Project Interconnection Facilities and Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment . 3.5.1 Construction of Project Interconnection Facilities; Installation of Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment . As soon as practicable but no less than four (4) months prior to the expected commercial operation date of the Project of any Constructing Buyer/Co-Tenant, such Constructing Buyer/Co-Tenant will provide the Manager and each Co-Tenant with the proposed schedule, plans, engineering drawings, and requirements with respect to such Co-Tenant's Project Interconnection Facilities and any Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment, together with a copy of such Constructing Buyer's/Co-Tenant's Interconnection Agreement. The Manager may propose reasonable changes to such proposed schedule, plans, engineering drawings, and requirements with respect to such Constructing Buyer's/Co-Tenant's Project Interconnection Facilities and such Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment and a Constructing Buyer/Co-Tenant will use commercially reasonable efforts to incorporate such suggested changes; provided, however, that no Constructing Buyer/Co-Tenant will be required to make such suggested changes to the extent that such changes would increase the costs to such Constructing Buyer/Co-Tenant or conflict with the provisions of the applicable Interconnection Agreement, Prudent Utility Practices, or any and all applicable Governmental Approvals. Notwithstanding anything in this Agreement to the contrary, a Buyer may provide written notice to Pumpjack, together with the plan, engineering, drawing and requirements of the Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment prior to the timeframe for the construction of the Project Interconnection Facilities. If a Buyer provides such notice with sufficient time for Pumpjack to incorporate such Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment into the construction of the Shared Facilities engineering and construction schedule, then Pumpjack will design and construct, at requesting Buyer's cost, such Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment during construction of the Shared Facilities. Any Constructing Buyer/Co-Tenant installing any Project Interconnection Facilities and Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment will keep the Manager informed on a regular basis regarding the status of the development and project schedule for such Project Interconnection Facilities and Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment. Such Constructing Buyer/Co-Tenant and the Manager will cooperate and coordinate plans to assemble, construct or install any applicable interconnection facilities and to install meters, bus interface and other interconnection equipment in and with the Shared Facilities. Any Constructing Buyer/Co-Tenant will, to the fullest extent commercially reasonable and subject to Prudent Industry Practices, (i) minimize any interference with any other Co-Tenant's use of the Shared Facilities, such Co-Tenant's Shared Premises Easement, and its Project, (ii) schedule during an off-peak or low insolation period any required curtailment or disconnection of the Shared Facilities to conduct interconnection activities, in order to minimize the impact on the Project of any other Co-Tenant, (iii) provide at least ninety (90) days prior written notice to the other Co-Tenants and the Manager of commencement of such interconnection activities together with a reasonably detailed description thereof, including dates and times of such construction and curtailment or disconnection, if any, and (iv) take into consideration any changes in the installation plans or timing of installation reasonably requested by the other Co-Tenants. Any Constructing Buyer/Co-Tenant installing any Project Interconnection Facilities and Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment or causing Pumpjack to install any Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment will pay (in advance, in the case of any installation or improvements undertaken by Pumpjack) the full cost and expense thereof and any reasonable costs and expenses of any improvements to the Shared Facilities that are required in order to accommodate the interconnection of such Constructing Buyer's/Co-Tenant's Project Interconnection Facilities with the Shared Facilities or the operation, and maintenance of such Constructing Buyer's/Co-Tenant's Project Interconnection Facilities in accordance with the requirements of this Agreement; provided, however, that, without in any way limiting the foregoing obligations, any Constructing Buyer/Co-Tenant paying the full cost and expense of any Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment will upon request be entitled to reimbursement from each other Co-Tenant aside from Pumpjack of a pro rata share of such cost and expense, in each case in proportion to such Co-Tenants' relative Percentage Interests. In addition, any Constructing Buyer/Co-Tenant installing any Project Interconnection Facilities and Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment will reimburse each other Co-Tenant for all Net Production Losses accruing during any period of curtailment or disconnection caused by or resulting from such installation, it being hereby agreed that payment of the Net Production Losses will be such other Co-Tenants' sole and exclusive remedy for loss of revenue and other Consequential Damages accruing during such period of curtailment or disconnection. Each Co-Tenant agrees that the actual Consequential Damages related to the losses in revenues accruing during such period of curtailment or disconnection would be difficult to compute and that the Net Production Losses represent a good faith estimate of the actual Consequential Damages related to such losses in revenues. 3.5.2 Shared Telecommunications Equipment . Pumpjack will arrange with the applicable telecommunications services providers for the design, construction, and installation of the Shared Telecommunications Equipment in connection with the design and construction of the other initial Shared Facilities. Each Buyer will be responsible for payment or reimbursement of its Percentage Interest share of the costs of the design, construction, and installation of the Shared Telecommunications Equipment at the time of the Closing of the acquisition of such Co-Tenant's Undivided Interest as provided in Section 2.12.2; provided, however, that any Co-Tenant paying the full cost and expense of any Shared Telecommunications Equipment will upon request be entitled to reimbursement of a pro rata share of such cost and expense, in proportion to such Co-Tenant's relative Percentage Interests, from each other Co-Tenant aside from Pumpjack. Upon request by a Buyer, Pumpjack shall provide reasonable supporting documentation for the costs for such Shared Telecommunications Equipment. 3.5.3 Temporary Construction Easement . Each Co-Tenant, to the fullest extent within its right, power and authority, and on the terms and subject to the conditions of such Co-Tenant's Substation Easement Agreement and Pumpjack Consent, hereby grants to each Constructing Buyer/Co-Tenant, during the period of construction of Project Interconnection Facilities and Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment by such Constructing Buyer/Co-Tenant, a temporary and non-exclusive access and construction sub-easement on, over, under and across the Shared Premises to the extent (and only to the extent) reasonably necessary for such Constructing Buyer/Co-Tenant to construct and install such Constructing Buyer's/Co-Tenant's Project Interconnection Facilities and Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment, and to interconnect with, access, modify and utilize any Shared Facilities to deliver energy over such Shared Facilities (collectively, the "Temporary Construction Easement") consistent with such Co-Tenant's Shared Facilities use rights; provided, however, that the Co-Tenant will install such interconnection equipment in the Shared Facilities substation consistent with the plans and timeframe as set forth in Section 3.5.1. Each Co-Tenant's Temporary Construction Easement will expire fourteen (14) days after the date of commencement of commercial operation of such Co-Tenant's Project. The grantee of any such Temporary Construction Easement agrees to comply in full with the requirements of any underlying easement or other agreement, covenant, condition or restriction applicable to the property upon which such Temporary Construction Easement is granted. 3.5.4 Indemnification by Constructing Buyer/Co-Tenant . Each Co-Tenant connecting its Project Interconnection Facilities to the Shared Facilities and installing any Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless the other Co-Tenant(s), in accordance with the terms and conditions of Article 11, from and against any and all Liabilities, including Net Production Losses, incurred as a result of such construction activity. 3.6 Covenants Running With the Land . The covenants of each Party in this Agreement will be deemed to be covenants running with and binding upon each Party's interest in the Shared Facilities pursuant to applicable Law for the term of this Agreement. 4. SHARED EXPENSES 4.1 Liabilities for the Account of the Co-Tenants . Except as specifically set forth in this Agreement, each Co-Tenant shall be solely responsible for its Liabilities relating to its Project and Project Specific Assets, including all Liabilities arising from acquiring, designing, installing, constructing, using, operating, maintaining and repairing its Project Specific Assets, and the cost of any Network Upgrades associated with its Project or Project Specific Assets. Bravo I and Bravo II shall each be solely responsible for all Liabilities related to negotiating, documenting and obtaining any required Governmental Approvals for the Bravo I Interconnection Agreement or Bravo II Interconnection Agreement, respectively. Each Co-Tenant shall solely have rights to any reimbursements owing, if any, from CAISO or PG&E (or a successor interconnection provider) for the costs of any Network Upgrades paid by such Co-Tenant. Each Co-Tenant shall, at its sole cost and expense, maintain or cause to be maintained in good working order and repair at all times each part of its Project that connects with or affects the Shared Facilities. Further, each Co-Tenant shall be responsible for all Liabilities arising from such Co-Tenant's actions or inactions in violation of this Agreement. 4.2 Shared Expenses . On and after the Closing with respect to any purchase of an Undivided Interest by a Co-Tenant, such Co-Tenant shall be responsible for and shall make payment to the Manager (in accordance with Section 4.3) for Shared Expenses in proportion to such Co-Tenant's Percentage Interest in the Shared Facilities. For the avoidance of doubt, each Co-Tenant shall be responsible for and shall reimburse the Manager (in accordance with Section 4.3) only for Shared Expenses that are due and payable after the Closing with respect to the exercise of such Co-Tenant's Option. Unless and until such time as there is any other Co-Tenant under this Agreement, Pumpjack shall be solely responsible for all costs and expenses (including taxes) relating to the Shared Facilities and the Shared Premises. 4.3 Invoicing, Late Payments . No later than ten (10) days after the end of each calendar month following the Closing Date, the Manager shall invoice each Co-Tenant for its respective portion of the Shared Expenses. The Manager's invoice shall include a reasonably detailed description of the Shared Expenses and each Co-Tenant's share of the Shared Expenses, along with wire transfer instructions for making payment to the Manager. Each Co-Tenant shall make all payments to Manager (or directly to another Co-Tenant to whom the Shared Expenses may be payable) under this Section 4.3 by wire transfer of immediately available funds as provided in the Manager's invoice, or by an alternative form of payment mutually agreed to by the Parties, within thirty (30) days of receipt of such invoice. All sums not paid within thirty (30) days after receipt of Manager's invoice shall thereafter bear interest at the Default Rate until paid in full. Each Co-Tenant shall have the right to audit, and receive supporting documentation for, any expenses or other amounts required to be paid by such Co-Tenant under this Agreement. If there is a Dispute as to any amount invoiced by Manager, the Co-Tenants shall pay all amounts not in Dispute in accordance with this Section 4.3. Any Disputes with respect to payments under or in connection with this Agreement shall be resolved in accordance with the provisions of Article 15. The Co-Tenants shall pay any disputed amount ultimately determined as payable with interest thereon at the Default Rate accruing from the date that is thirty (30) days following the date of receipt of the Manager's disputed invoice. 5. USE OF SHARED FACILITIES 5.1 Use . Subject to the other requirements of this Agreement, each Co-Tenant shall have the right to use its Undivided Interest and its Shared Premises Easement to effectuate interconnection service for its respective Project under the Pumpjack Interconnection Agreement, the Bravo I Interconnection Agreement, or the Bravo II Interconnection Agreement, as applicable. No Co-Tenant shall have the right at any time to allocate, share, or otherwise permit the use by any other Person of all or any portion of such Co-Tenant's rights to use the Shared Facilities or such Co-Tenant's Shared Premises Easement, unless required to do so by applicable Law. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, the foregoing restrictions on use include any use of the capacity of electrical transmission lines, breakers, air switches, or other equipment comprising the Shared Facilities in an amount exceeding such Co-Tenant's Undivided Interest. 5.2 Shared Facilities Representatives . Each Co-Tenant may, by written notice to the other Co-Tenant(s) and the Manager, designate an individual (the "Shared Facilities Representative") who will have authority to bind the Co-Tenant in all matters concerning this Agreement (other than to amend this Agreement) and to communicate with the other Co-Tenant(s) and the Manager regarding issues relating to this Agreement, including operational and maintenance issues. Each Co-Tenant may change its Shared Facilities Representative at any time and from time to time by prior written notice to the other Co-Tenant(s) and the Manager. 5.3 Liens . No Buyer shall, prior to the Closing with respect to any purchase of an Undivided Interest by such Buyer, directly or indirectly, create, incur, or permit to exist any lien on the Shared Facilities, including but not limited to taxes (other than for taxes not yet due), judgments, construction work, repair and restoration, or materials furnished. No Co-Tenant shall create, permit or suffer to exist, by, through or under the Co-Tenant or the Co-Tenant's Representatives, any Liens on the Shared Facilities, or on the Undivided Interests of any other Co-Tenant, in each case, other than Permitted Liens. Each Co-Tenant shall take prompt steps to discharge any Lien (other than a Permitted Lien) filed against any portion of the Shared Facilities, or the Undivided Interest of any other Co-Tenant. If any Co-Tenant responsible for the imposition of a Lien (other than a Permitted Lien) fails to discharge promptly any such Lien, any other Co-Tenant, in addition to any other rights it may have at law or equity for a breach of this Agreement, shall have the right to notify the responsible Co-Tenant in writing and to take any reasonable action to satisfy, defend, settle or otherwise remove the Lien at the responsible Co-Tenant's expense. 6. OBLIGATIONS AND CERTAIN RIGHTS OF THE CO-TENANTS 6.1 Standards of Performance . Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement to the contrary, each Co-Tenant will use the Shared Facilities and such Co-Tenant's Shared Premises Easement, and perform its obligations under this Agreement, in each case in all material respects, in accordance with (a) all applicable Laws, (b) Prudent Industry Practices, (c) such Co-Tenant's Interconnection Agreement, (d) the terms and conditions of such Co-Tenant's Substation Easement Agreement, and (e) any and all applicable Governmental Approvals. Except as provided herein, no Co-Tenant will take any action (whether by affirmative action or omission) or fail to perform any obligation under this Agreement, such Co-Tenant's Interconnection Agreement, or any Governmental Approvals that materially and adversely affects any other Co-Tenant or another Co-Tenant's Project or that gives rise to a Liability affecting any other Co-Tenant, another Co-Tenant's Project, the Shared Facilities, or the Shared Premises, including any action, omission or failure to perform an obligation that results in damage to, disconnection of, or an outage of another Co-Tenant's Project or the Shared Facilities. 6.2 Taxes . Unless otherwise directed by the Co-Tenants, the Manager shall pay all taxes levied against the Shared Facilities before delinquency and before any fine, interest or penalty will become due or be imposed for their non-payment, except that the Manager may withhold payment of any tax if the Manager is contesting the payment of such tax in good faith by appropriate proceedings and such proceeding does not involve any danger of the sale, forfeiture or loss of any part of such Shared Facilities, including the posting of any bond that is required by applicable Law to avoid such sale, forfeiture or loss while the payment of such tax is being contested and notifies all of the Co-Tenants thereof in writing at least thirty (30) days before such payment is due or paid. All such taxes and assessments paid by the Manager shall be treated as Shared Expenses and invoiced to the Co-Tenants in accordance with Section 4.3. Each Co-Tenant acknowledges that it shall be liable for its own taxes with respect to the Shared Facilities or any Project Specific Assets. 6.3 Environmental Compliance . Each Co-Tenant shall, with respect to its Project, (including its Project Specific Assets, and including the Project Site upon which its Project is installed), be responsible for and shall have exclusive control over all investigations, studies, clean up, corrective action or response or remedial action required by (a) any Governmental Authority now or hereafter authorized to regulate environmental or other matters, or (b) any consent decree or court or administrative order now or hereafter applicable to such Co-Tenant's use, operation or ownership of its Project (including its Project Specific Assets and Project Site). Each Co-Tenant shall be responsible, in proportion to its relative Percentage Interest (unless the Co-Tenants are disproportionately at fault with respect to the applicable Liabilities, in which case responsibility shall be apportioned in proportion to each Co-Tenant's relative fault), for all Liabilities related to any investigations, studies, clean up, corrective action or response or remedial action or related activities with respect to such Shared Facilities. 6.4 Interconnection .
