A Co-Tenant may take such actions as may be necessary to comply with any order received from CAISO with respect to such Co-Tenant's Project, and nothing herein shall require a Co-Tenant to violate the requirements of any such order. This Agreement does not grant any rights to interconnection service or other rights under any Interconnection Agreement to any Person that is not a party to such Interconnection Agreement. 6.5 Voting or Approval Rights . Unless and until such time as there is any other Co-Tenant under this Agreement, Pumpjack alone shall have the right to approve of matters affecting the Shared Facilities. On and after the Closing with respect to any purchase of an Undivided Interest by a Co-Tenant, such Co-Tenant shall, unless specifically provided in this Agreement, have the right to vote or give its approval on any matter requiring or needing a vote or approval of the Co-Tenants. On and after any Closing Date, unless otherwise specified herein, a Majority Vote of the Co-Tenants shall be required for any approval to be provided hereunder; provided, however, that during the occurrence and continuance of an Event of Default by a Co-Tenant, the voting and approval rights of such Co-Tenant shall be suspended except with respect to Major Decisions. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, (a) any Major Decision shall require the unanimous approval of all of the Co-Tenants and (b) any action that would materially and adversely impact any Buyer's Option or the right, title, or interest of a Buyer in its Option shall require the approval of such Buyer. 6.6 Relationship of the Co-Tenants . The rights, duties, obligations, and liabilities of the Parties under this Agreement will be several and not joint or collective, and no Party shall be responsible for the default of any other Party under this Agreement. It is not the intention of the Parties to create, nor will this Agreement be deemed to create, any partnership (for federal income tax purposes or otherwise), agency, joint venture or trust, or to authorize any Party (other than the Manager on behalf of the Co-Tenants, and then only as and to the extent expressly provided in this Agreement) to act as an agent, servant or employee for any other Party. Each Party will remain solely responsible for the actions of its own employees. 6.7 Regulatory Status . 6.7.1 Certification as Qualifying Facility . Each Co-Tenant shall, not later than 120 days prior to the initial anticipated production, sale, or delivery of any energy (including test energy), capacity or ancillary services, from its Project, provide written notice thereof to the other Co-Tenant(s) and the Manager. Each Co-Tenant shall use commercially reasonable efforts to maintain its Project's status as a Qualifying Facility for so long as such Co-Tenant is a Co-Tenant under this Agreement. No Co-Tenant shall take any action that could reasonably foreseeably adversely impact the ability of any other Co-Tenant to qualify its Project as a Qualifying Facility. 6.7.2 Required Regulatory Approvals . The Parties shall cooperate and use commercially reasonable efforts to obtain the Buyer Required Regulatory Approvals and the Pumpjack Required Regulatory Approvals. The Parties shall negotiate in good faith any amendments or revisions to this Agreement as may be necessary to obtain the Buyer Required Regulatory Approvals and Pumpjack Required Regulatory Approvals. 6.8 No Dedication of Property; No Public Access . Each Party agrees that entering into this Agreement, performing its obligations hereunder, or exercising its rights hereunder, either in whole or part, is not intended to be, and shall in no way be construed as or deemed to be, a dedication to public or quasi-public use or purpose of any of the Project Specific Assets of the Party, the Project Specific Assets of another Party, any Shared Facilities, or any portion of the foregoing. The Co-Tenants undertake to cooperate in enforcing such requirement for limiting physical access to the Shared Facilities, including permitting the Manager to establish and enforce procedures and protocol for security, safety, and protection of the Shared Facilities. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Parties shall comply with requirements set forth in any Governmental Approvals. 6.9 Co-Location Rights . Each Co-Tenant hereunder shall be permitted to encroach upon the Shared Facilities with its Project Specific Assets solely to the extent necessary to develop, construct, operate or maintain such Co-Tenant's Project, provided that any such encroachments or overhang shall be subject to the noninterference protections of Section 3.4 above. In particular, any Co-Tenant's exercise of rights under this Section 6.9 shall be permitted only in accordance with Prudent Industry Practices, and shall not interfere with or endanger the construction, operation, or maintenance of the Shared Facilities. In the event of a conflict in the location or operation of the Shared Facilities and any Project Specific Assets, the Shared Facilities shall take priority over the Project Specific Assets. 6.10 Cooperation in Financing . The Parties acknowledge that a Buyer or Co-Tenant may finance all or part of its costs in connection with the transactions contemplated by this Agreement. In the event that a Buyer or Co-Tenant enters into such financing, the Parties acknowledge and agree that certain aspects of the transactions contemplated hereby may need to be modified in certain respects to accommodate the reasonable requirements of any Financing Party with respect to such financing. The Parties hereby agree to cooperate in good faith and to use commercially reasonable efforts to assist a Buyer or Co-Tenant to make or to obtain any modification of this Agreement or the transactions contemplated hereby reasonably requested by a Buyer or Co-Tenant to allow the Buyer or Co-Tenant to obtain such financing upon commercially reasonable terms, including obtaining consents to the assignment for security purposes of a Buyer's Option or Co-Tenant's Undivided Interest as reasonably requested by such Buyer or Co-Tenant's Financing Party, executing estoppels, consents for the benefit of the Financing Parties and other similar agreements as may be reasonably requested by the requesting Party and its Financing Parties, and making any filings required by such requesting Party for regulatory compliance, obtaining Governmental Approvals, or in connection with the operation and maintenance of such requesting Party's Project. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Parties will not be required to cooperate with a Buyer or Co-Tenant to implement any modification that would (i) relieve such Buyer or Co-Tenant of any of its obligations under this Agreement or the transactions contemplated hereby, (ii) decrease the economic benefits or increase the costs of the transactions contemplated hereby to the other Parties, or (iii) create any additional economic or legal risks to the other Parties or any of their respective Affiliates. The financing Buyer or Co-Tenant will be responsible for the reasonable attorneys' fees and other out-of-pocket costs incurred by the other Parties in providing such cooperation and efforts under this Section 6.10. 6.11 Co-Tenants' Responsibilities to Manager . On and after the Closing with respect to any purchase of an Undivided Interest by a Co-Tenant, such Co-Tenant shall do each of the following: (a) with the exception of information and data the Manager is required to record and collect hereunder, provide the Manager with all material information, including information related to permits, agreements, data and documents for the Shared Facilities that is reasonably required for Manager to perform its obligations under this Agreement; (b) promptly examine all material documents submitted by Manager and render any necessary decisions pertaining thereto; (c) promptly make material decisions required under this Agreement or any other agreement that the Manager may be requested to administer hereunder and respond to all reasonable requests from Manager for approval made hereunder; (d) promptly execute and deliver such evidence of Manager's authority hereunder as may be reasonably required by third parties; and (e) except where the same are being disputed in good faith, promptly make all payments and approve and incur all expenditures required in connection with the Shared Facilities in accordance with this Agreement. 6.12 Outage, Curtailment or Disconnection . To the extent any Co-Tenant's Project is disconnected, incurs any downtime, is curtailed or experiences an outage, in each case with resulting loss of production and revenue to such Project, and the loss arises from another Co-Tenant's actions or inactions, then, in any such case, the responsible Co-Tenant shall reimburse the other Co-Tenant for the applicable Net Production Losses within thirty (30) days after delivery of notice and supporting documentation of the loss. 6.13 Allocation of Line Losses and Capacity Reductions . (a) On and after each Closing Date, line losses that occur over the Shared Facilities shall be shared among the Co-Tenants in proportion to each Co-Tenant's respective Percentage Interest. (b) Subject to the provisions of Section 6.12, any interruption, reduction in deliveries of, or other curtailment of electrical power through the Shared Facilities, or to the point of interconnection designated in the Interconnection Agreements, in each case as caused by the actions or inactions of any Co-Tenant, shall be allocated as follows: first, and to the fullest extent possible, to the Co-Tenant that caused such interruption, reduction, or curtailment; and, second, and only if and to the extent that such interruption, reduction, or curtailment cannot be allocated in full to the Co-Tenant that caused such interruption, reduction, or curtailment, to the other Co-Tenant(s) in proportion to each such Co-Tenant's respective Percentage Interest. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the foregoing, any interruption, reduction in deliveries of, or other curtailment of electrical power through the Shared Facilities, or to the point of interconnection designated in the Interconnection Agreements, that in each case (i) results from any instruction with respect to any Co-Tenant's Project from CAISO or PG&E to curtail energy deliveries, or (ii) is not caused by the actions or inactions of any Co-Tenant, shall be allocated on a pro rata basis based on each Co-Tenant's Percentage Interest, except, in the case of the foregoing clause (i), when such pro rata allocation would be in violation of the applicable curtailment instruction from CAISO or PG&E. 6.14 Withdrawal of a Co-Tenant . 6.14.1 Withdrawal Notice . At its election in its sole discretion, a Co-Tenant may relinquish its Undivided Interest and cease to be a Co-Tenant by delivery of a written notice (a "Withdrawal Notice") to the other Co-Tenant(s) and the Manager in which such Co-Tenant certifies, as of the date specified in the Withdrawal Notice (a "Withdrawal Date"), that it has obtained FERC approval (if, and to the extent necessary) under Section 203 of the Federal Power Act in connection with the grant, sale, transfer, assignment and conveyance of its Undivided Interest to the other Co-Tenant(s) as contemplated in Section 6.14.2. A Co-Tenant shall provide at least thirty (30) days advance written notice to the other Co-Tenant(s) and the Manager of its intention to no longer be a Co-Tenant. 6.14.2 Transfer of Undivided Interest . Effective upon the Withdrawal Date, upon and subject to the terms, conditions, restrictions and reservations set forth in this Agreement, (a) the withdrawing Co-Tenant shall, without additional compensation, be deemed to have transferred to the other Co-Tenant(s) its Undivided Interest in and to the Shared Facilities in proportion to each such other Co-Tenant's respective Percentage Interest and (b) such Co-Tenant shall contemporaneously execute in recordable form, and deliver to the Manager for recording, a valid termination of its Substation Easement Agreement. Any such transfer shall be made AS IS, WITH ALL FAULTS AND WITHOUT (EXCEPT AS AND TO THE EXTENT OTHERWISE EXPRESSLY PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT) ANY REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES WHATSOEVER, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, AND SPECIFICALLY EXCLUDING ANY WARRANTY OF TITLE, MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR ANY OTHER WARRANTY ARISING UNDER STATUTORY OR COMMON LAW. Notwithstanding the foregoing, no such transfer shall relieve the withdrawing Co-Tenant of any Liability that it has incurred prior to the Withdrawal Date. 6.14.3 Release of Rights to Shared Facilities . Without limiting the provisions of Section 6.14.2, effective upon the Withdrawal Date, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the withdrawing Co-Tenant shall, without additional compensation, either release, assign or terminate its rights in the Shared Facilities, as may be requested by any remaining Co-Tenant in writing; provided, however, that no such release, assignment or termination shall be permitted to be undertaken in any manner that would materially and adversely affect any remaining Co-Tenant's Project Specific Assets or the Shared Facilities. 6.14.4 Withdrawing Co-Tenant's Remaining Rights and Obligations Under Agreement . After its Withdrawal Date, the withdrawing Co-Tenant shall remain a party to this Agreement but shall have no rights or obligations under this Agreement except those set forth in Section 4.1, Section 4.2 and Section 4.3 (in each case, relating to the payment of its Percentage Interest (prior to the Withdrawal Date) of (x) Shared Expenses incurred prior to the Withdrawal Date and (y) Removal Costs, as reasonably projected by the Manager), Section 5.3, Article 11 and Article 13. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, no withdrawal of a Co-Tenant shall relieve such Co-Tenant of any Liability accruing or arising prior to the date on which such Co-Tenant ceases to serve as a Co-Tenant. 6.14.5 Responsibility of Withdrawing Co-Tenant for Manager's and Other Co-Tenants Costs and Expenses 6.14.6 . All reasonable costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees and expenses, incurred by the Manager or any Co-Tenant in connection with the actual or proposed withdrawal of a Co-Tenant shall be paid or reimbursed by the withdrawing Co-Tenant upon any request therefor from the Manager and respective Co-Tenants. 7. APPOINTMENT, REMOVAL AND RESIGNATION OF MANAGER 7.1 Engagement of the Manager . The Manager shall manage, operate, and maintain the Shared Facilities and perform other duties pertaining to the Shared Facilities, all as set forth in this Agreement. The Manager accepts such engagement and agrees to perform such duties in accordance with the terms and conditions hereof. The Manager shall hold such position until it resigns or is removed or replaced as provided by this Article 7. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the foregoing, if pursuant to any provision under this Agreement, Manager is precluded from performing any service, Manager shall be relieved from its obligation to provide such service. 7.2 Relationship . Except as otherwise set forth herein (a) neither the Manager nor any of its Affiliates, employees, subcontractors, vendors or suppliers, nor any employees of any of the foregoing Persons, shall be deemed to be agents, representatives, employees, or servants of the Co-Tenants as a result of this Agreement or of performing any duties hereunder, and (b) no such Person as a result of entering into this Agreement or of performing any duties hereunder shall have the right, authority, obligation or duty to assume, create or incur any liability or obligation, express or implied, against, in the name of, or on behalf of the Co-Tenants. In no case shall this Agreement be construed to create a relationship of partnership or any other association of profit between the Co-Tenants, on the one hand, and the Manager or any of its Affiliates, employees, subcontractors, vendors or suppliers, or any employees of any of the foregoing Persons, on the other hand. 7.3 Removal of the Manager . The Manager may be removed only by the affirmative Majority Vote of the Co-Tenants if (a) the Manager (i) breaches any material provision of this Agreement in such a way that has a material adverse effect on the operation or maintenance of the Shared Facilities, or (ii) is negligent or engages in willful misconduct in the performance of its obligations hereunder, and (b) the Manager fails to cure any such breach or action within thirty (30) days after receiving notice thereof from any Co-Tenant (or, if such cure cannot reasonably be completed within such thirty (30) day period, the Manager fails to undertake and promptly cure upon receipt of such notice or fails to give adequate assurances to each Co-Tenant that such breach or action will be so cured with all reasonable speed). Notwithstanding anything above in this Section 7.3, at any time after (x) Pumpjack sells, assigns, or otherwise Transfers its rights or interests in the Shared Facilities or this Agreement, in either case pursuant to the terms of this Agreement, or (y) Pumpjack undergoes a Change of Control, Buyer(s) (prior to any one Closing or both Closings) and the other Co-Tenant(s) (excluding Pumpjack) (after any one Closing or both Closings) may remove the Manager. 7.4 Resignation of the Manager . The Manager shall have the right to resign for convenience, without any liability for such resignation, upon ninety (90) days' prior written notice to the Co-Tenants and their respective Financing Parties. The Co-Tenants shall appoint a successor Manager within such ninety (90) day period and the Manager shall, in good faith, continue to perform its duties and obligations as the Manager until such time as a successor Manager is appointed hereunder. If the Co-Tenants fail to agree upon a replacement Manager within such ninety (90) day period, the Co-Tenants shall submit such Dispute for resolution pursuant to the Dispute resolution procedures set forth in Article 15. During such ninety (90) day period, the Manager shall cooperate with the Co-Tenants in the transition of the performance of the Manager's obligations to the Co-Tenants or to a successor Manager, as the case may be. During any such time that the Manager is obligated pursuant to this Section 7.4 to continue to perform its obligations hereunder, the Manager shall remain liable for the performance of such obligations in accordance with this Agreement as if no notice of resignation had been delivered. 7.5 Obligations at End of Term or Upon Removal or Resignation . The Manager shall perform all services with respect to the Shared Facilities as required under this Agreement through the date of termination or expiration of this Agreement or the removal or resignation of the Manager in accordance with this Article 7, and each Co-Tenant shall make all payments required by it hereunder through such date, with such payment to be made in full within 30 days after such termination, expiration, removal, or resignation. No removal of the Manager in accordance with this Article 7 shall be effective unless and until a successor Manager is appointed with the applicable approval that was required for removal of the Manager under Section 7.3. In the event of any removal or resignation of the Manager in accordance with this Article 7, the Manager shall provide reasonable assistance to the Co-Tenants to assure a smooth, efficient transition of its services to a replacement Manager, for which Manager shall be reimbursed its reasonable expenses in connection therewith. 7.6 Immunities . Subject to the Section 11.4, the Manager and its members, managers, directors, officers, employees and agents shall not be responsible for any action taken or omitted to be taken by it or them under this Agreement or in connection herewith, except for its or their own gross negligence or willful misconduct as determined by a final non-appealable judgment of a court of competent jurisdiction. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, the Manager and its members, managers, directors, officers, employees and agents may consult with legal counsel, independent public accountants, and other experts selected by it or them and shall not be liable for any action taken or omitted to be taken in good faith by it or them in accordance with the advice of such counsel, accountants or experts. 7.7 Non-Reliance . Each Co-Tenant represents, as of the Closing with respect to any purchase of an Undivided Interest by such Co-Tenant, that it has reviewed the terms of such documents and information that it has deemed appropriate, and that it has made its own appraisal in respect of the Shared Facilities, in each case, independently and without reliance on the Manager. Each Co-Tenant shall review the terms of such other documents and information that such Co-Tenant may deem appropriate at any relevant time, and shall continue on an ongoing basis to make its own appraisal in respect of the Shared Facilities, or in respect of any other matter for which such Co-Tenant may be entitled to vote or give consent under this Agreement, in any such case, independently and without reliance on the Manager. 7.8 Liability . The Manager shall be discharged and released from any Liability of the Manager accruing or arising under this Agreement on and after the date on which the Manager ceases to serve as Manager; provided, however, that no removal or resignation of the Manager shall relieve the Manager of any Liability accruing or arising prior to the date on which the Manager ceases to serve as Manager. 8. DUTIES OF THE MANAGER 8.1 In General . The Manager, at the direction of the Co-Tenants as specified in this Agreement, at all times shall do the following: (a) cause the Shared Facilities to be designed, constructed, operated, and maintained in accordance with the Pumpjack Interconnection Agreement and the other Interconnection Agreements (to the extent that such agreements contain provisions relevant to the Shared Facilities and do not impose obligations on the Manager that are materially more burdensome than those imposed under the Pumpjack Interconnection Agreement), Prudent Industry Practices and any applicable Laws; (b) take any and all action as may be reasonably necessary to enforce and preserve warranty claims or other claims related to the Shared Facilities; (c) oversee all investigations, studies, clean up, corrective action or response or remedial action required by any Governmental Authority applicable to the Co-Tenants' use, operation or ownership of the Shared Facilities and keep all Co-Tenants fully apprised as to the foregoing matters affecting the Shared Facilities; (d) perform all regulatory reporting, auditing and other related matters (including with respect to any obligations imposed by NERC or FERC on the Shared Facilities) arising out of, or in connection with, the Shared Facilities; and (e) take such other actions as are reasonably necessary to effectuate the foregoing, unless in any such case, such action is not in the commercially reasonable interest of the Co-Tenants. 8.2 Specific Authority . Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, the Manager may take any of the following actions in the performance of its services, without further approval from the Co-Tenants: 8.2.1 interface with each Co-Tenant with respect to day-to-day management, operations and maintenance of the Shared Facilities; 8.2.2 negotiate, enter into, execute, acknowledge or amend agreements relating to the management, use, operation, maintenance, and repair of the Shared Facilities, in each case in accordance with the then-effective Annual Shared Facilities Operating Plan and Budget; provided, however, that (a) no such actions shall materially and adversely affect the rights or privileges of any of the Co-Tenants under this Agreement, or the use or operation of or access to the Shared Facilities by any of the Co-Tenants, or the availability of the Shared Facilities to any of the Co-Tenants, and (b) the Manager shall provide each Co-Tenant with copies of any such agreement or amendment promptly upon execution thereof; 8.2.3 pay and collect amounts due in connection with the Shared Facilities, and maintain one or more bank accounts wherein funds received by the Manager in connection with its duties hereunder shall be maintained, in each case in accordance with the then-effective Annual Shared Facilities Operating Plan and Budget; 8.2.4 procure insurance policies pursuant to Article 12; and 8.2.5 execute, acknowledge, and deliver any and all instruments and take such other steps as are reasonably necessary to effectuate the foregoing and as are consistent therewith. 8.3 Limitation on Authority . The Manager shall not, without the approval of all of the Co-Tenants: 8.3.1 create or cause to be created any Lien (other than Permitted Liens) on any of the Shared Facilities; 8.3.2 take any action that would prevent the development, construction or operation of, otherwise result in a material impairment of, a Co-Tenant's Project or the Shared Facilities; 8.3.3 take or permit any action (whether by affirmative action or omission) which would cause any person reasonably to believe that the Manager is a partner of the Co-Tenants or authorized to bind such Co-Tenants, except as expressly authorized herein; 8.3.4 sell, assign, mortgage, encumber, convey or otherwise transfer all or any portion of the Undivided Interests held by any Co-Tenant, or any components of the Shared Facilities (other than as permitted under this Agreement); or 8.3.5 borrow funds or otherwise incur indebtedness on behalf of a Co-Tenant. 8.4 Agency . Subject to the limitations on the Manager's authority set forth in this Agreement, the Annual Shared Facilities Operating Plan and Budget, the Manager is hereby authorized by the Co-Tenants to enter into, on behalf of the Co-Tenants and as agent of the Co-Tenants, but in the name of the Co-Tenants, purchase orders and service agreements in connection with the delivery of the Manager's services under this Agreement. Title to any supplies, consumables, tools, software, office equipment or furniture acquired by the Manager on behalf of the Co-Tenants will be vested in the Co-Tenants in accordance with their respective Percentage Interests, and the Manager will have no right, title, or interest therein or thereto other than as specifically provided in this Agreement. 8.5 Reporting; Notices; Records . The Manager shall, from time to time, provide reports to the Co-Tenants sufficient to keep the Co-Tenants reasonably apprised as to significant matters concerning the operation, maintenance and repair of the Shared Facilities, including such matters related thereto as may have a material impact on the operation, maintenance, and repair of each Co-Tenant's Project. The Manager's reporting obligations shall include all of the following: 8.5.1 provide data and information, to the extent requested by a Co-Tenant and to the extent in the Manager's possession or reasonably available to the Manager, regarding the Shared Facilities' performance and availability; 8.5.2 providing to the Co-Tenants written notice of any communications, orders or requirements of any Governmental Authority received by the Manager, or of which the Manager has received notice orally or in writing, and affecting the Shared Facilities; 8.5.3 collecting and providing any information, to the extent such information is in Manager's possession or is reasonably available to Manager, regarding the Shared Facilities required for any reports to, or filings with, any Governmental Authorities; 8.5.4 reporting promptly (and in any event within 24 hours of becoming aware thereof) to the Co-Tenants and to any other Persons entitled to receive such notice any incident of Emergency on the Shared Facilities or otherwise adversely impacting any of the Shared Facilities, of which the Manager becomes aware; and 8.5.5 providing such other reports and information as may be reasonably requested by the Co-Tenants under the terms of this Agreement. 8.6 Audit Rights . The Manager shall allow the Co-Tenants and the Co-Tenants' authorized Representatives to inspect and audit the Books and Records maintained by the Manager with respect to the Shared Facilities (at the Co-Tenants' sole cost and expense); provided, however, that the Co-Tenants shall have the right to inspect and audit such Books and Records only for any period that is within two calendar years from the date of an applicable payment is made hereunder or the final settlement or disposition of any claim made pursuant to this Agreement. If any such inspection or audit discloses an error and that, as a result thereof, any overpayment or any underpayment has occurred hereunder, the amount thereof, together with interest at the Default Rate (except that any underpayment caused by the actions or inactions of Manager will not bear interest), shall be paid, within thirty (30) days after receipt of an invoice (with reasonable supporting detail) therefor, to the Co-Tenant(s) to which it is owed by the Co-Tenant(s) obligated therefor; provided, further, that a Co-Tenant shall be liable only for any amounts hereunder that relate to errors discovered and disclosed within the inspection and audit period provided for in this provision. 8.7 Annual Shared Facilities Operating Plan and Budget . On or before September 30th of each year, the Manager shall provide each Co-Tenant with a draft of (i) the annual budget for the Shared Facilities for the immediately following calendar year and (ii) the annual operating plan setting forth the underlying assumptions and implementation plans for such budget (the "Annual Shared Facilities Operating Plan and Budget"). The Annual Shared Facilities Operating Plan and Budget will include a separate operating budget and capital budget and will set forth, in reasonable detail, anticipated operations plans and costs, including forecasts of electricity production and corresponding usage of major commodities, repairs and capital improvements (including major maintenance and a cost/benefits analysis for proposed capital improvements), Scheduled Outages, routine maintenance and overhaul schedules, procurement (including equipment acquisitions and spare parts and consumable inventories indicating a breakdown of capital items and expense items), staffing, personnel and labor activities (including unit rates for labor and holidays to be observed), administrative activities, data regarding other work proposed to be undertaken by the Manager and regarding expected environmental performance, together with an itemized estimate of all Shared Expenses to be incurred in connection therewith. Items in the budget will be divided and identified as (a) target budget items and (b) non-target budget items, which are items over which the Manager has little or no control. Each Co-Tenant may submit any comments or questions to the Manager within thirty (30) days of receipt of the draft Annual Shared Facilities Operating Plan and Budget. The Manager shall incorporate any comments received and shall provide a final Annual Shared Facilities Operating Plan and Budget to the Co-Tenants by November 30th of each year for approval by Majority Vote of the Co-Tenants. If, by the first day of any calendar year, the Co-Tenants and the Manager are unable to reach agreement concerning any portion of the Annual Shared Facilities Operating Plan and Budget for such calendar year, such Dispute will be submitted for resolution in accordance with the Dispute resolution procedures set forth in Article 15. Pending the outcome of such Dispute resolution process and amendment of the Annual Shared Facilities Operating Plan and Budget to reflect such outcome for purposes of the remainder of such calendar year, the portion of the Annual Shared Facilities Operating Plan and Budget that is in Dispute will be resolved by using the portion of the Annual Shared Facilities Operating Plan and Budget as proposed by the Manager for such disputed portion. The Annual Shared Facilities Operating Plan and Budget may be amended during the year by Majority Vote of the Co-Tenants. 8.8 Emergencies . In the event of any Emergency involving the Shared Facilities, the Manager shall take such action as may be reasonable and necessary to prevent, avoid or mitigate injury, loss of life, or damage or destruction of property and shall, as soon as reasonably practicable, report any such Emergency, including the Manager's response thereto, to the Co-Tenants. 8.9 Cooperation with CAISO and PG&E . Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, the Manager shall cooperate with CAISO and PG&E (and any successor agency or other entities having authority over the Shared Facilities) and any purchaser under a Project Offtake Agreement to make all such information, reports, logs and other documents relating to the Shared Facilities available to CAISO, PG&E and such purchaser as may be required pursuant to the terms and conditions of the Interconnection Agreements, CAISO's open access transmission tariff and the Project Offtake Agreement. In addition, the Manager and each Party that has exercised, or that has a good-faith intention to exercise, its Option shall provide prompt written notice to the other parties of, and cooperate with each other to accommodate, any requests of CAISO, PG&E and any purchaser under a Project Offtake Agreement to make any reasonable amendments to this Agreement, any existing applicable Interconnection Agreement, and any existing applicable Project Offtake Agreement to accommodate or recognize this Shared Facilities Agreement. 8.10 Cooperation with Shared Premises Landowner . Pumpjack will use its commercially reasonable efforts to assist Bravo I and Bravo II in obtaining, on terms and conditions reasonably acceptable to Pumpjack, the grant by the Shared Premises Landowner of a Shared Premises Easement to each of Bravo I and Bravo II on the terms and conditions set forth in the Substation Easement Agreement. In furtherance thereof, Pumpjack will, at the applicable Buyer's sole cost and expense, provide the Pumpjack Consent to the Shared Premises Landowner. 8.11 Inspection by Co-Tenants . The Manager shall permit the Co-Tenants to access the Shared Facilities at reasonable intervals and during regular business hours for purposes of verifying the Manager's operation of the Shared Facilities in accordance with the requirements of this Agreement or inspecting the Shared Facilities, provided that in each case the applicable Co-Tenant arranges any such inspection with Manager reasonably in advance thereof and complies with the safety requirements imposed by Manager. The Manager at all times will retain responsibility for performing its services as Manager in accordance with the requirements of this Agreement, regardless of whether or not the Co-Tenants have reviewed or inspected such services, plans, documentation or other acts or items. 8.12 Risk of Loss; Loss Events . 8.12.1 Risk of Loss . As between the Co-Tenants and Manager, the Co-Tenants (in proportion to their respective Percentage Interests) shall be responsible for the risk of loss to the Shared Facilities or any portion thereof during the term of this Agreement. 8.12.2 Loss Events . Upon the occurrence of a Loss Event, the Manager shall, as soon as reasonably practicable, prepare a written proposal (a "Restoration Proposal") in consultation with the Co-Tenants to rebuild, repair, restore, or replace the portion of the Shared Facilities affected by such Loss Event, which Restoration Proposal shall contain, in appropriate detail, (a) a budget identifying all categories and approximate amounts reasonably anticipated to be incurred, (b) a progress and completion schedule and (c) a written plan, in each case, for the proposed rebuilding, repair, restoration, or replacement of the Shared Facilities. The Manager, to the extent necessary or prudent, may coordinate preparation of the Restoration Proposal with similar activity undertaken by or on behalf of any of the Co-Tenants arising out of the Loss Event in respect of Project Specific Assets. Any costs, expenses or other Liabilities associated with the preparation of the Restoration Proposal shall be Shared Expenses reimbursed by each Co-Tenant in proportion to its Percentage Interest as of the date of the Loss Event. Within 30 days after receipt of a Restoration Proposal from the Manager, each Co-Tenant shall notify the Manager and each other Co-Tenant in writing of whether it elects to participate in the rebuilding, repair, restoration, or replacement of the Shared Facilities. Any costs, expenses or other Liabilities associated with the rebuilding, repair, restoration, or replacement of the portion of the Shared Facilities affected by a Loss Event shall be Shared Expenses reimbursed by each Co-Tenant that has elected to participate in such activity, in proportion to its Percentage Interest. Any Co-Tenant that elects not to participate in the rebuilding, repair, restoration, or replacement of the Shared Facilities or that fails, within the thirty (30) day period specified above, to provide notice of its election, shall be deemed to have given a Withdrawal Notice as of the earlier of (i) the date of such election or (ii) the end of such 30 day period. 8.13 Manager Representative . The Manager may, by written notice to the Co-Tenants, designate an individual representative of the Manager (the "Manager Representative") whose instructions, requests, and decisions will be binding upon the Manager in all matters concerning this Agreement, except that the Manager Representative shall not have the authority to amend this Agreement. The Manager shall have the right to change the Manager Representative at any time and from time to time by written notice to the Co-Tenants. 8.14 Standards of Performance . Throughout the term of this Agreement, the Manager shall perform its services as Manager and all other obligations under this Agreement in accordance with the Pumpjack Interconnection Agreement and the other Interconnection Agreements (to the extent that such agreements contain provisions relevant to the Shared Facilities and do not impose obligations on the Manager that are materially more burdensome than those imposed under the Pumpjack Interconnection Agreement), the applicable Annual Shared Facilities Operating Plan and Budget, Prudent Industry Practices, and all applicable Laws and Governmental Approvals. 8.15 Assignment of Warranties . The Manager shall be responsible for enforcing, on behalf of the Co-Tenants, all manufacturer, construction, and other warranties with respect to the Shared Facilities and any parts or materials associated therewith. The Co-Tenants and the Manager shall cooperate in the enforcement of the foregoing warranties, and to the extent possible, any Co-Tenant holding a warranty for a portion of the Shared Facilities shall assign such warranty to Manager for enforcement and collection, and any funds received in lieu of repair or replacement shall be used for repair or replacement of the affected Shared Facilities. Any excess warranty funds shall be distributed to the Co-Tenants in proportion to their Percentage Interest. The Manager's documented out of pocket costs and expenses incurred in enforcing said warranties shall be included in the Shared Expenses hereunder. 9. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES 9.1 Representations and Warranties . As of the date of this Agreement, each Party represents and warrants to the other Party that: 9.1.1 it is duly organized, validly existing and in good standing under the Laws of the jurisdiction of formation; 9.1.2 it has the power to execute and deliver this Agreement and to perform its obligations under this Agreement and has taken all necessary limited liability company actions to authorize such execution and delivery and performance of such obligations; 9.1.3 its execution and delivery of this Agreement and its performance of its obligations under this Agreement do not violate or conflict with any Law applicable to it; with any provision of its certificate of formation or limited liability company agreement; with any order or judgment of any court or other agency of government applicable to it or any of its assets; or with any contractual restriction binding on or affecting it or any of its assets; and 9.1.4 this Agreement constitutes the Party's legal, valid, and binding obligation, enforceable against it in accordance with its terms (subject to applicable bankruptcy, reorganization, insolvency, moratorium or similar Laws affecting creditors' rights generally and subject, as to enforceability, to equitable principles of general application, regardless of whether enforcement is sought in a proceeding in equity or at law). 9.2 Exclusivity of Warranties . THE REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT ARE EXCLUSIVE, AND NO OTHER WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, WHETHER STATUTORY, EXPRESS, OR IMPLIED (INCLUDING ALL WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE) WILL APPLY TO THE SUBJECT MATTER OF THIS AGREEMENT. 10. FORCE MAJEURE Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, each Party's obligations under this Agreement shall be suspended by any Force Majeure if and to the extent that such Party is prevented or delayed from performing by reason of the Force Majeure; provided, however, that (a) the prevention or delay of performance shall be of no greater scope and of no longer duration than is reasonably caused by the Force Majeure and required by any remedial measures, (b) no obligations of any Party that were required to be performed before the occurrence of such causes shall be excused as the result of the occurrence, and (c) each Party shall use reasonable commercial efforts to remedy its inability to perform; provided, further, that no Force Majeure shall excuse any payment obligations due hereunder. If the performance by any Party of its obligations under this Agreement is affected by any Force Majeure, such Party shall as soon as practicable notify the other Parties of the nature and extent thereof. 11. INDEMNIFICATION 11.1 Cross-Indemnity by Co-Tenants . Notwithstanding anything in Section 11.8, each Co-Tenant hereby agrees to defend, indemnify and hold harmless each other Co-Tenant and Buyer, and each such Co-Tenant's and Buyer's Representatives (but not in any event, however, including the Manager) from and against any and all Liabilities to the extent caused by, resulting from or arising out of (i) the negligent acts or omissions, bad faith, or recklessness or willful misconduct of the indemnifying Co-Tenant under or in connection with this Agreement, (ii) any breach of or default under this Agreement by the indemnifying Co-Tenant, (iii) any breach or violation by the indemnifying Co-Tenant of its Project conditional use permit or any other permit relating to its Project or Project Interconnection Facilities, or (iv) any Hazardous Substances spilled, generated, released or introduced into or on the Shared Premises by, through or on behalf of the indemnifying Co-Tenant. 11.2 Indemnification by Buyers . To the fullest extent permitted by law, each Buyer hereby agrees to defend, indemnify and hold harmless each other Party and its Representatives from and against any and all Liabilities to the extent caused by, resulting from or arising out of (i) the negligent acts or omissions, bad faith, or recklessness or willful misconduct of the indemnifying Buyer, (ii) any breach of or default under this Agreement by the indemnifying Buyer, (iii) any breach or violation by the indemnifying Buyer of its Project conditional use permit or any other permit relating to its Project, or (iv) any Hazardous Substances spilled, generated, released or introduced into or on the Shared Premises by, through or on behalf of the indemnifying Buyer. 11.3 Indemnification of Manager . To the fullest extent permitted by law, each Co-Tenant hereby jointly and severally agrees to defend, indemnify and hold harmless the Manager and its Representatives (but not in any event, however, including any Co-Tenant Affiliate of the Manager) from and against any and all Liabilities to the extent caused by, resulting from or arising out of (i) the negligent acts or omissions, bad faith, or recklessness or willful misconduct of the indemnifying Co-Tenant, (ii) any breach of or default under this Agreement by the indemnifying Co-Tenant, or (iii) the acts of the Manager under and in accordance with its authority under this Agreement, provided that the liability of each Co-Tenant under this subsection (iii) will be in proportion to such Co-Tenant's respective Percentage Interest; provided, however, that the Manager and its Representatives will not be entitled to indemnification hereunder to the extent any action, claim, demand, cost or liability results from breach of this Agreement or from the Manager's gross negligence, bad faith, recklessness or willful misconduct, or, if and to the extent such indemnification relates to Project Specific Assets, by the Co-Tenants not owning any share of such Project Specific Assets. 11.4 Indemnification by Manager . To the fullest extent permitted by Law, the Manager hereby agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless each Co-Tenant and Buyer, and each Co-Tenant's and Buyer's Representatives, from and against any and all Liabilities to the extent caused by, resulting from or arising out of the Manager's negligent acts or omissions, bad faith, recklessness or willful misconduct or other failure to perform its obligations under this Agreement. The Manager further agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless each Co-Tenant and Buyer from and against any and all Liens filed in connection with the performance of the Manager's services under this Agreement, other than Permitted Liens and Liens resulting from non-payment for services or equipment by a Co-Tenant or Buyer. Net Production Losses . Notwithstanding Section 14.6 or any other provision of this Agreement, but without limiting the liability of any Party other than as expressly provided in this Section 0, the sole and exclusive remedy of any Party, and of each such Party's Representatives, for any losses in revenues and other Consequential Damages related thereto caused by or resulting from the inability to generate, transmit or sell electricity or other products or services and accruing during a period of disconnection of any Shared Facilities that arises from (i) the connection, repair or replacement of any Project Specific Assets of the indemnifying Co-Tenant or Buyer, or (ii) the negligence of the indemnifying Party or any of its Representatives, successors and assigns, or contractors or subcontractors of any tier, will be the indemnified Co-Tenant's or Buyer's Net Production Losses. Each Party agrees that the actual Consequential Damages related to losses in revenues arising from such disconnection would be difficult to compute and the Net Production Losses are a good faith estimate of the calculations utilized to determine the actual Consequential Damages and related losses in revenues that would be suffered. 11.5 Notice and Legal Defense . Promptly after receipt by any Person that is entitled to indemnification under this Agreement (each such Person, an "Indemnified Party") of any claim or notice or the commencement of any action, administrative or legal proceeding, or investigation as to which indemnity provided for in this Agreement may apply, the applicable Indemnified Party will notify the indemnifying Party hereunder in writing of such fact. The indemnifying Party hereunder will assume the defense thereof with counsel designated by the applicable indemnifying Party and reasonably satisfactory to the Indemnified Party; provided, however, that if the defendants in any such action include both the indemnifying Party and the applicable Indemnified Party, and the Indemnified Party will have reasonably concluded that there may be legal defenses available to it which are different from or additional to, or inconsistent with, those available to the applicable indemnifying Party, the Indemnified Party will have the right to select separate counsel to participate in the defense of such action on behalf of the Indemnified Party, at the applicable indemnifying Party's reasonable expense. The applicable indemnifying Party will not, without the written consent of the Indemnified Party, (a) settle or compromise any indemnity claim or consent to the entry of any final judgment that does not include as an unconditional term thereof the delivery by the claimant or plaintiff of a written release or releases from all liability in respect of such indemnity claim of all Indemnified Parties affected by such indemnity claim, or (b) settle or compromise any indemnity claim if the settlement imposes equitable remedies or material obligations on the Indemnified Party other than financial obligations for which such Indemnified Party will be indemnified under this Agreement. 11.6 Failure to Defend Action . Should an Indemnified Party be entitled to indemnification under this Article 11 as a result of a claim by a third party, and the indemnifying Party fails to assume the defense of such claim, the Indemnified Party may, at the expense of the indemnifying Party, contest (or, with the prior written consent of the indemnifying Party, settle) such claim. 11.7 Indemnification Amount . In the event that an indemnifying Party is obligated to indemnify and hold an Indemnified Party harmless under this Article 11 and except as may be otherwise limited in Section 11.5, the amount owing to the Indemnified Party will be the amount of such Indemnified Party's reasonable, documented actual out-of-pocket loss net of any insurance or other recovery (including deductibles but net of any reasonable third party out of pocket costs and expenses associated with such recoveries) (it being understood and agreed that the Indemnified Parties shall use their commercially reasonable efforts to seek insurance recoveries in respect of losses to be indemnified hereunder). If any insurance proceeds or other recoveries from third parties are actually realized (in each case calculated net of the reasonable third party out of pocket costs and expenses associated with such recoveries) by an Indemnified Party subsequent to the receipt by such Indemnified Party of an indemnification payment hereunder in respect of the claims to which such insurance proceedings or third party recoveries relate, the Indemnified Party shall hold such amounts in trust and appropriate refunds shall be made promptly to the indemnifying Party regarding the amount of such indemnification payment. 11.8 Liability of Co-Tenants Several . If for any reason whatsoever the Co-Tenants are or become jointly or jointly and severally liable to any third party for any obligation related to this Agreement and no Co-Tenant is required to indemnify the other Co-Tenants under Section 11.1, the respective liability of each of the Co-Tenants, as among themselves, will be limited severally to their respective Percentage Interests. Without limiting the foregoing, the liability of each Co-Tenant under this Section 11.8 will be in proportion to such Co-Tenant's respective Percentage Interest, and to the extent any indemnification obligations of the Co-Tenants under this Article 11 relate to any Project Specific Assets, any Co-Tenant not owning any share of such Project Specific Assets will not have any responsibility or liability for or with respect to any such indemnification obligations. Any Co-Tenant that may incur joint or joint and several Liability to a third party in excess of such Co-Tenant's Percentage Interest share thereof as provided in this Section 11.8 shall be entitled to contribution and indemnity from each other Co-Tenant on a proportionate basis. 11.9 Supremacy and Survival . The provisions expressed in this Article 11 will prevail over any conflicting or inconsistent provisions contained elsewhere in this Agreement and will survive termination of this Agreement. This Article 11 shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement until the expiration of the applicable statute of limitations. 12. INSURANCE 12.1 Shared Facilities Insurance . With the exception of workers' compensation insurance and unless otherwise agreed by all of the Co-Tenants in writing, the Manager will, on behalf of the Co-Tenants, procure or cause to be procured the insurance coverage for the Shared Facilities as outlined below. In the case of construction of any Project Interconnection Facilities, the cost of construction phase insurance required under Section 12.2 will be paid by the applicable Constructing Buyer/Co-Tenant. Unless otherwise provided herein or agreed to by the Co-Tenants, the cost of operational phase insurance required under Section 12.3 will be paid by each Co-Tenant in accordance with its respective Percentage Interest. Regardless of which Party arranges for the coverage of insurances, all insurances for the Shared Facilities will be maintained in accordance with this Article 8. 12.2 Construction Phase Insurance . 12.2.1 Builder's All-Risk Insurance . Without limiting any obligation of any Co-Tenant to its Financing Parties, during any construction each Constructing Buyer/Co-Tenant (in the case of its Project Interconnection Facilities) and the Manager (in the case of construction involving the Shared Facilities) will procure or cause to be procured, and maintain or cause to be maintained, at the applicable Co-Tenant's sole cost and expense, builder's all-risk insurance in an amount sufficient to replace any new or existing Shared Facilities that are subject to such construction and any new or existing Project Interconnection Facilities that are subject to such construction. Such policies will name the Manager and each of the other Co-Tenants as a named insured and their Financing Parties as additional insureds, if such coverage is available on commercially reasonable terms, and otherwise as loss payees. 12.2.2 General Liability Insurance . Without limiting any obligation of any Co-Tenant to its Financing Parties, and unless otherwise agreed in writing by all of the Co-Tenants, the Manager, as the case may be, will procure or cause to be procured, and maintain or cause to be maintained, liability insurance covering the respective activities of the Manager and Co-Tenants on the site of such Co-Tenant's Project Interconnection Facilities or the Shared Facilities, including general liability coverage and comprehensive automotive liability coverage. Such coverage will (i) have a minimum combined occurrence and annual limitation of One Million Dollars ($1,000,000), provided that such amount may be provided as part of a blanket policy covering other properties owned by Affiliates of the Manager, (ii) contain a blanket broad form contractual endorsement and severability of interest clause, and (iii) designate the Financing Parties, and their respective officers, directors, employees and agents as additional insureds. Furthermore, if a policy is on a "claims made" basis, such coverage will survive the termination of this Agreement until the expiration of the maximum statutory period of limitations in the State of California for actions based on contract or in tort. If coverage is on an "occurrence" basis, such coverage will be maintained for the term of this Agreement. 12.2.3 Workers' Compensation . Without limiting any obligation of any Co-Tenant to its Financing Parties, each Party will independently obtain and maintain appropriate workers' compensation insurance to comply with any statutory obligation imposed by workers' compensation or occupational disease laws. 12.3 Operational Phase Insurances . 12.3.1 Property Damage Insurance . Without limiting any obligation of any Co-Tenant to its Financing Parties, at all times after completion of construction of the Shared Facilities the Co-Tenants (or, at the written request of the Co-Tenants, the Manager, on behalf of the Co-Tenants) will procure or cause to be procured, and maintain or cause to be maintained, property damage insurance in an amount (i) sufficient to replace any Shared Facilities that may be affected by a loss, and (ii) that is reasonably acceptable to the Co-Tenants. Such policies will name the Manager and each of the Co-Tenants as named insureds in accordance with their respective Percentage Interests, and will name the Co-Tenants' Financing Parties as additional insureds if such coverage is available on commercially reasonable terms, and otherwise as loss payees. If the Co-Tenants do not request the Manager to procure or cause to be procured property damage insurance, each Co-Tenant will be responsible for and will pay its respective Percentage Interest of any property damage to the Shared Facilities. 12.3.2 General Liability Insurance . Without limiting any obligation of any Co-Tenant to its Financing Parties, at all times after completion of construction of the Shared Facilities the Co-Tenants (or, at the written request of the Co-Tenants, the Manager, on behalf of the Co-Tenants) will procure or cause to be procured, and maintain or cause to be maintained, liability insurance covering the respective activities of the Manager and the Co-Tenants on the Shared Premises, including general liability coverage and comprehensive automotive liability coverage. Such coverage will (i) have a minimum combined occurrence and annual limitation of One Million Dollars ($1,000,000), provided that such amount may (if such coverage is procured by the Manager on behalf of the Co-Tenants) be provided as part of a blanket policy covering other properties owned by Affiliates of the Manager, (ii) contain a blanket broad form contractual endorsement and severability of interest clause, and (iii) designate the Financing Parties, and their respective officers, directors, employees and agents as additional insureds. 12.3.3 Workers' Compensation . Without limiting any obligation of any Co-Tenant to its Financing Parties, each Party will independently obtain and maintain appropriate workers' compensation insurance to comply with any statutory obligation imposed by workers' compensation or occupational disease laws. 12.3.4 Project Interconnection Facilities . Without limiting any obligation of any Co-Tenant to its Financing Parties, at all times after completion of construction by any Co-Tenant of any Project Interconnection Facilities, such Co-Tenant (or, at the written request of such Co-Tenant, the Manager, on behalf of such Co-Tenant) will procure or cause to be procured, and maintain or cause to be maintained, (i) property damage insurance in an amount sufficient to replace any such Project Interconnection Facilities that may be affected by a loss, and (ii) liability insurance covering the respective activities of the Manager and the Co-Tenants on the sites of such Project Interconnection Facilities, including general liability coverage and comprehensive automotive liability coverage having a minimum combined occurrence and annual limitation of One Million Dollars ($1,000,000). If any Co-Tenant contracts with the Manager to procure and maintain insurance covering such Co-Tenant's Project Interconnection Facilities, such Co-Tenant may elect that the Manager carry such insurance as part of the policy of insurance maintained by the Manager for the Shared Facilities; provided, however, such Co-Tenant will pay any increase in insurance premiums resulting from the addition of such Project Interconnection Facilities to the insurance policy for the Shared Facilities. 12.4 Waiver of Claims for Insured Events . 12.4.1 Waiver . Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Agreement, each Co-Tenant waives each and every claim that arises or may arise in its favor against the Manager and any other Co-Tenant during the term of the Agreement for any and all loss of, or damage to any Shared Facilities, to the extent such loss or damage is an insured event covered by the insurance to be maintained in accordance with this Agreement and to the extent the applicable insurance proceeds are paid to or for the benefit of such Co-Tenant; provided, however, the foregoing waiver will not apply to any uninsured deductible or self-insured retention or to instances where the relevant insurer disputes that the relevant event of loss was an insured event covered by the applicable insurance policy. 12.4.2 Use of Insurance Proceeds . In the event of an insured event, all insurance proceeds (other than those applicable to third party or workers compensation losses) with respect to the Shared Facilities will be pooled and the Manager will apply the proceeds to reconstruction to the extent permitted under each Co-Tenant's arrangements with its Financing Parties. If there is an uninsured loss or the insurance proceeds are inadequate, if such uninsured loss is not subject to an action for which a Co-Tenant is obligated to indemnify other Co-Tenants pursuant to the terms of this Agreement, each Co-Tenant will be responsible for payment of its respective Percentage Interest of all costs and expenses of repair or replacement of such damaged Shared Facilities. 12.5 Form and Content of Insurance . Without limiting any obligation of any Party to its Financing Parties, all policies and binders with respect to insurance provided pursuant to this Article 12 will be as follows: 12.5.1 Form of Policies . All insurance provided for hereunder will be placed on forms reasonably acceptable to the Co-Tenants, the Constructing Buyers/Co-Tenants and Financing Parties. 12.5.2 Insurance Companies . All insurance required hereunder will be with insurers with an A.M. Best rating of A- or better or with insurers otherwise deemed acceptable to Manager, the Co-Tenants, Constructing Buyers/Co-Tenants, and the Financing Parties. 12.5.3 Severability . All general liability insurance will contain a severability of interest provision. 12.5.4 Non-Recourse . All insurance will provide that there will be no recourse against the additional insureds for the payment of premiums or commissions or (if such policies provide for the payment thereof) additional premiums or assessments. 12.6 Additional Requirements . Without limiting any obligation of any Co-Tenant to its Financing Parties: 12.6.1 Waiver of Subrogation . All insurance required hereunder to be maintained by the Co-Tenants and Manager will provide for the waiver of any right of subrogation by the insurers thereunder against the Manager and the Co-Tenants and their Financing Parties and their Representatives, and any right of the insurers to any setoff or counterclaim or any other deduction, whether by attachment or otherwise, in respect of any liability of any such Person insured under such policy. 12.6.2 Notice of Cancellation . To the extent reasonably practicable, all insurance required hereunder will provide that it may not be canceled or materially changed without giving all of the Co-Tenants, the Constructing Buyers/Co-Tenants, the Manager, and the Financing Parties at least thirty (30) days prior written notification thereof, except in cases of non-payment of premium for which ten (10) days prior written notice will be provided (unless a longer notice period for non-payment is agreed to by the relevant insurer). 12.6.3 Certificates; Proof of Loss . Prior to any entry on the site of a Project or the Shared Facilities by a Co-Tenant, the Manager and the Co-Tenants will furnish certificates of insurance to the Manager and, upon request, to the other Co-Tenants and their respective Financing Parties, evidencing the insurance required of such Manager or Co-Tenant pursuant to this Agreement. Each of the Co-Tenants, the Financing Parties of the Co-Tenants and the Manager will be listed as additional insureds on the policies of the other Co-Tenants. The Manager or the Co-Tenant maintaining each policy hereunder will make all proofs of loss under each such policy, and will take all other action reasonably required to ensure collection from insurers for any loss under any such policy, except that each of the Co-Tenants and the Manager will cooperate and assist in the preparation of such proofs of loss and take such other actions on behalf of the Co-Tenants as may be requested by the Co-Tenants or the Manager. 12.6.4 Payment of Deductibles and Self-Insured Retention Amounts . Each Co-Tenant will be responsible for payment of deductibles or self-insured retention in proportion to such Co-Tenant's Percentage Interest. 12.6.5 Subcontractor Insurance . The Manager will require all subcontractors to carry adequate coverage in accordance with Manager's normal practice, prior to entry on the Shared Facilities and during the time in which they are engaged in performing services to be furnished by Manager, and will require such subcontractors to provide written evidence of such insurance and additional insured status prior to entry on the Shared Facilities. The Manager will provide the Co-Tenants, upon request, with current certificates of insurance evidencing such coverage as may be reasonably requested. All such insurance policies will name the Manager, Co-Tenants, and Constructing Buyers/Co-Tenants, and the Financing Parties of the Co-Tenants and Constructing Buyers/Co-Tenants, as additional named insureds, and will name the Financing Parties as loss payees. 12.6.6 Notification . Each Party agrees to advise the other Parties as soon as practicable in writing of any notice of claim relating to the Shared Facilities and to which insurance pursuant to this Article 12 applies. 12.6.7 Co-Tenant's and Financing Party's Rights . Should the Manager or any Co-Tenant fail to provide or maintain any of the insurance policies required of it, and should such failure continue for more than five (5) Business Days after notice of cancellation is provided pursuant to Section 12.6.2, the other Co-Tenants will, without waiving any other rights and remedies available to such other Co-Tenants under this Agreement, have the right to provide or maintain such coverage at such defaulting Party's expense. 12.6.8 Additional Insured . As applicable, coverage provided by the property policies described in this Agreement will insure the Co-Tenants, the Manager, and the Financing Parties in each case as their interests may appear. 12.6.9 Loss Payable . The Co-Tenants, the Manager, and the Financing Parties or their agent will be "loss payees" as their interests may appear under construction phase builders all-risk and operational phase property all-risk insurance. 12.7 Co-Tenant Project Insurance Requirements . Without limiting any other provision of this Agreement, from and after the Closing Date with respect to the purchase of an Undivided Interest by any Co-Tenant, such Co-Tenant, at its sole cost, shall procure and maintain in effect in full force and effect the insurance policies and coverages described in Exhibit H. 12.8 Failure of Required Insurance to Be Commercially Available . If any insurance required to be maintained by a Party hereunder ceases to be available on commercially reasonable terms in the commercial insurance market, such Party shall provide written notice to the other Parties, accompanied by a certificate from an independent insurance advisor of recognized national standing, certifying that such insurance is not available on commercially reasonable terms in the commercial insurance market for electric generating plants of similar type, geographic location and design. Upon receipt of such notice, such first-mentioned Party shall use commercially reasonable efforts to obtain other insurance that would provide comparable protection against the risk to be insured, and the other Parties shall not unreasonably withhold their consent to modify or waive such requirement. 13. CONFIDENTIALITY 13.1 Confidentiality . 13.1.1 Restrictions on Disclosure . Confidential Information shall not be disclosed or permitted to be disclosed by the Receiving Party to any other person or entity not a Party hereto without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, except: (a) to the Receiving Party's Representatives; provided, however, that the Receiving Party informs its Representatives of the confidential nature of the Confidential Information; and (b) to the extent such information is required to be disclosed under applicable Law or stock exchange regulations or by a governmental or court order, decree, regulation or rule; provided, however, that the Receiving Party uses commercially reasonable efforts to give prompt written notice to the Disclosing Party in advance of such disclosure to permit the Disclosing Party to obtain a protective order against or otherwise to limit the disclosure (in connection with which the Receiving Party shall reasonably cooperate with the Disclosing Party); provided, further, that, in any case, the Receiving Party shall only disclose that portion of the Confidential Information that, in the opinion of the Receiving Party's legal counsel, is required to be disclosed and shall use its commercially reasonable efforts to ensure further confidential treatment of the Confidential Information so disclosed. 13.1.2 Permitted Uses of Confidential Information . The Receiving Party shall use the Confidential Information, or permit the same to be used by the Receiving Party's Representatives, in connection with the Receiving Party's exercise of its rights and performance of its obligations under this Agreement and for no other purpose whatsoever. 13.1.3 Confidentiality of Agreement . Notwithstanding anything in this Agreement to the contrary, any Party shall be permitted to provide a copy of this Agreement to (i) the purchaser(s) under any agreement for the sale of power or other products or services from such Party's Project, (ii) FERC, (iii) CAISO, and (iv) the Participating TO under such Party's Interconnection Agreement. 13.1.4 Availability of Equitable Relief . The Parties acknowledge that the Disclosing Party would not have an adequate remedy at law for money damages for a breach of the covenants contained in this Section 13.1. Accordingly, the Disclosing Party shall be entitled to seek an injunction restraining such disclosure and other equitable relief (including specific performance), without the requirement of posting a bond or other security. 13.1.5 Return of Confidential Information 13.1.6 . Confidential Information will remain the property of Disclosing Party. Written Confidential Information, and any copies thereof, shall be returned to Disclosing Party or destroyed immediately upon its written request, and no copies will be retained by Receiving Party or its Representatives, unless the Disclosing Party otherwise expressly agrees or as may be required under applicable law, rule, regulation, Receiving Party's internal record-keeping policies or any electronic copies as may be stored on Receiving Party's electronic records storage system as a result of automated back-up systems. Any Confidential Information so retained shall remain subject to this Agreement. 14. CO-TENANT EVENTS OF DEFAULT, TERMINATION, REMEDIES, LIMITATION OF LIABILITY 14.1 Events of Default . The occurrence and continuation of any of the following events at any time during the term of this Agreement, except to the extent caused by, or resulting from, an act or omission of another Party in breach of this Agreement or an event of Force Majeure, will constitute an event of default (an "Event of Default"): 14.1.1 Payment . A Co-Tenant fails, on and after the Closing Date with respect to the purchase of an Undivided Interest by such Co-Tenant, to pay when due any amounts required to be paid by such Co-Tenant under this Agreement, and such failure to pay is not cured within fifteen days following written notice from Manager or any other Co-Tenant specifying the amount to be paid; provided, however, that such period will be extended for so long as the allegedly defaulting Co-Tenant is disputing in good faith such amount pursuant to the procedures set forth in Article 15. 14.1.2 Other Defaults . A Party fails to cure any other failure to perform a material obligation under this Agreement within thirty (30) days following written notice from the Party specifying the nature of the failure to perform, provided that if the default is not reasonably capable of being cured within thirty (30) days, then the default will be deemed cured if the defaulting Party commences, diligently pursues, and completes action that remedies the default within ninety (90) days of receipt of such notice. 14.1.3 Interconnection Agreement, Project Offtake Agreement, or Substation Easement Agreement . A Co-Tenant breaches, or causes the breach of, its Interconnection Agreement, any Project Offtake Agreement, or its Substation Easement Agreement, and such breach would have a material adverse effect on any of the Shared Facilities, this Agreement, any other Interconnection Agreement or Project Offtake Agreement, or the Project of any non-defaulting Co-Tenant, and the defaulting Co-Tenant fails to cure such breach within the time permitted by such agreement. Each Co-Tenant agrees, within 24 hours after receipt by such Co-Tenant of any notice of default under or in connection with its Interconnection Agreement, any Project Offtake Agreement, or its Substation Easement Agreement, to provide a copy of such notice to the Manager and the other Co-Tenants, regardless of the party or the contract that is alleged to be in default in the notice. 14.1.4 Bankruptcy . If a Party is adjudicated as bankrupt, becomes insolvent, enters into an arrangement or composition with the Party's creditors, suffers permanent or temporary court-appointed receivership of substantially all of such Party's property, makes a general assignment for the benefit of creditors, or files a voluntary bankruptcy petition. 14.2 Remedies . Upon the occurrence and during the continuation of an Event of Default, the non-defaulting Parties will have any and all of the following remedies, exercisable only after due inquiry that an Event of Default has occurred and is continuing: 14.2.1 Tender Performance . In its sole and absolute discretion, any Co-Tenant may cure any default by the Manager that would negatively impact such Co-Tenant's sales of electricity. In its sole and absolute discretion, a Party may cure the default of the defaulting Co-Tenant by making or tendering the required payment or performance, and permitting the defaulting Co-Tenant's Project to remain connected to the Shared Facilities and sales of electricity by the defaulting Co-Tenant to be continued. 14.2.2 Disconnect Co-Tenant . To the extent such Event of Default affects or relates to any Shared Facilities, to cause the disconnection of the defaulting Co-Tenant's Project from such Shared Facilities; provided, however, that the defaulting Co-Tenant's Project will be permitted to reconnect promptly when and if the Event of Default is cured, and any and all damages suffered and incurred by the non-defaulting Co-Tenants as a result of such default have been compensated. 14.2.3 Specific Performance . The Parties agree that damages may be an inadequate remedy for an Event of Default under this Agreement, and that each Party will be entitled to seek injunctive and other equitable relief (including specific performance) against any other Party to prevent or eliminate such default. 14.2.4 Other Rights and Remedies . To exercise any and all other rights and remedies which the non-defaulting Parties might otherwise have under this Agreement, at law or in equity. 14.3 Reimbursement of Expenses to Cure; Lien . If any Party elects to cure an Event of Default of another Co-Tenant, the defaulting Co-Tenant will reimburse any curing Party for its expenses incurred in rendering the cure, plus interest at the Default Rate. The Party(ies) curing the default will have a lien on the defaulting Co-Tenant's Undivided Interest, to the extent of the amount expended by the curing Party(ies) in remedying the default (including attorneys' fees), and the defaulting Co-Tenant hereby appoints each curing Party as its attorney-in-fact to file, record and otherwise assert such lien, to the extent of the expenditures in relation to such cure or remedy. 14.4 Remedies Cumulative . No right, remedy or election given by any term of this Agreement will be deemed exclusive but each will be cumulative with all other rights, remedies and elections available under this Agreement, at law or in equity. 14.5 Waiver of Partition . THE CO-TENANTS WILL NOT HAVE AND HEREBY WAIVE THE RIGHT TO PARTITION ALL OR ANY PORTION OF THE SHARED FACILITIES, OR TO MAKE APPLICATION TO ANY COURT OR AUTHORITY OR TO COMMENCE OR PROSECUTE ANY ACTION OR PROCEEDING FOR PARTITION OF THE SHARED FACILITIES. EACH PARTY WILL BE ENTITLED TO A DECREE OR ORDER RESTRAINING OR ENJOINING SUCH PARTITION, APPLICATION, ACTION OR PROCEEDING UPON ANY BREACH OF THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION 14.5. THE CO-TENANTS ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE THAT THEY HAVE BEEN PAID FULL CONSIDERATION FOR THE WAIVER PROVIDED IN THIS SECTION 14.5. 14.6 Limitation of Liability . NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF THIS AGREEMENT TO THE CONTRARY, IN NO EVENT, WHETHER AS A RESULT OF BREACH OF CONTRACT, TORT LIABILITY (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR STRICT LIABILITY), OR OTHERWISE, WILL ANY PARTY BE LIABLE TO ANY OTHER PARTY FOR SPECIAL, INDIRECT, PUNITIVE, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OF ANY NATURE WHATSOEVER, INCLUDING CLAIMS OF CUSTOMERS, COST OF MONEY, LOSS OF PROFIT, LOSS OF USE OF CAPITAL OR REVENUE, EXCEPT TO THE EXTENT SUCH DAMAGES ARE OTHERWISE PAYABLE AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH HEREIN, INCLUDING IN ARTICLE 11 OR SECTIONS 3.5.1, 3.5.4 AND 6.12 ABOVE. NOTWITHSTANDING THE FOREGOING OR ANY OTHER PROVISION IN THIS AGREEMENT, THE FOREGOING LIMITATIONS OF LIABILITY WILL NOT LIMIT THE LIABILITY OF ANY PARTY TO ANY OTHER PARTY FOR OR WITH RESPECT TO THIRD PARTY CLAIMS. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF THIS AGREEMENT TO THE CONTRARY, IN NO EVENT, WHETHER AS A RESULT OF BREACH OF CONTRACT, TORT LIABILITY (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR STRICT LIABILITY), OR OTHERWISE, WILL THE AGGREGATE LIABILITY OF THE MANAGER ARISING UNDER THIS AGREEMENT EXCEED (1) IN THE CASE OF CLAIMS COVERED BY INSURANCE, THE PROCEEDS OF THE APPLICABLE INSURANCE MAINTAINED PURSUANT TO THIS AGREEMENT BY OR ON BEHALF OF THE MANAGER, PLUS TWO HUNDRED THOUSAND DOLLARS ($200,000) (INCLUSIVE OF ANY PREMIUMS AND DEDUCTIBLES PAID BY THE MANAGER IN CONNECTION WITH SUCH INSURANCE AND ANY COSTS OR EXPENSES INCURRED BY THE MANAGER IN CONNECTION WITH THE RECOVERY OF ANY SUCH INSURANCE PROCEEDS), AND (2) IN THE CASE OF CLAIMS NOT COVERED BY INSURANCE, TWO HUNDRED THOUSAND DOLLARS ($200,000); PROVIDED HOWEVER, THAT IN NO EVENT SHALL THE OUT-OF-POCKET LIABILITY OF THE MANAGER UNDER OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT EXCEED TWO HUNDRED THOUSAND DOLLARS ($200,000) IN THE AGGREGATE. 15. DISPUTE RESOLUTION Unless stated otherwise herein, all Disputes shall be resolved in accordance with the Dispute resolution procedures set forth in Exhibit I. 16.
