MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS 17.1 Transfers . 17.1.1 Transfer by Buyer or Co-Tenant . (a) Except as permitted in this Section 17.1, no Buyer or Co-Tenant may Transfer all or any part of its interest in the Shared Facilities or any of its rights or interests under this Agreement without obtaining the prior written consent of the other Buyers and Co-Tenants, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed; provided, however, that no such consent shall be required for (i) a Transfer of an Option or an Undivided Interest by a Financing Party in exercise of its rights under any financing agreement with a Buyer or a Co-Tenant, including by a foreclosure sale, deed in lieu of foreclosure or otherwise, or (ii) the Transfer by a Buyer or a Co-Tenant of all its rights and interests in the Shared Facilities and this Agreement to a purchaser, assignee or transferee of all of such Party's right, title, and interest in and to its Project, such that the holder of such rights and interests in the Shared Facilities and this Agreement is also the owner of all of the right, title, and interest in and to such Project. Without limiting the foregoing, any Transfer of all or a portion of a Buyer's Option or a Co-Tenant's Undivided Interest or any other rights and interests in this Agreement (not including any assignment to a Financing Party for collateral security purposes, but including a Transfer of an Option or an Undivided Interest by a Financing Party in exercise of its rights under any financing agreement with a Buyer or a Co-Tenant, including by a foreclosure sale, deed in lieu of foreclosure or otherwise) shall require that, as of the effective date of such Transfer, (1) the transferee shall own the transferring Buyer's or Co-Tenant's Project, such that immediately following such Transfer ownership of such rights and interests in the Option or the Undivided Interest and this Agreement is identical to ownership of such Project, (2) the transferee shall have creditworthiness immediately after such Transfer that is not substantially less than that of the transferring Buyer or Co-Tenant immediately prior to the Transfer, (3) neither the transferee nor any of its Affiliates shall, at any time within the three (3) years prior to the effective date of such Transfer, have been engaged in any litigation (not including adversarial or other administrative proceedings) or arbitration or other dispute resolution proceedings against Pumpjack or any Affiliate of Pumpjack, (4) the transferee agrees in writing to bound by all the terms and conditions of this Agreement in the place and stead of the transferring Buyer or Co-Tenant, and (5) all required Governmental Approvals have been obtained, including (if, and to the extent necessary) authorization from FERC under Section 203 of the Federal Power Act. (b) The Transfer of any direct or indirect interest in the membership interests or other equity securities of any Party, including in connection with any sale, merger, reorganization or tax equity financing, and including any Change of Control of a Party, shall be expressly permitted and shall not require the consent or approval of any other Party hereunder. (c) Any Transfer pursuant to this Section 17.1 (i) will relieve the transferring Buyer or Co-Tenant of any obligation under this Agreement accruing or arising after the effective date of such Transfer, but only on condition that the transferee agrees, in writing, to assume all such obligations, and (ii) will relieve the transferring Buyer or Co-Tenant of any obligation under this Agreement accruing or arising prior to the effective date of such Transfer only to the extent consented to in writing by the other Buyers and Co-Tenants (which consent will not be unreasonably withheld or delayed). Any attempted or purported Transfer of any interest in any Option, the Shared Facilities or this Agreement, made other than in accordance with this Section 17.1, either voluntarily or by operation of law, will be null and void and of no force or effect whatsoever. 17.1.2 Transfer by Manager . The Manager may not Transfer all or any part of its rights or interests under this Agreement without the prior written consent granted by Majority Vote of the Co-Tenants (such consent not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed), and the applicable transferee has assumed, in writing, all of the duties and obligations of the Manager under this Agreement. Any such Transfer (a) will relieve the Manager of any obligation under this Agreement accruing or arising after the effective date of such Transfer, but only on condition that the transferee agrees, in writing, to assume all such obligations, and (b) will relieve the Manager of any obligation under this Agreement accruing or arising prior to the effective date of such Transfer only to the extent consented to in writing by the Co-Tenants (which consent may not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed). 17.2 Right to Encumber . 17.2.1 Right to Encumber . Each Co-Tenant may at any time pledge, collaterally assign, encumber, or grant a security interest in its own Undivided Interest and in its rights under this Agreement to any of its Financing Parties. Each Co-Tenant shall, at any time and from time to time during the term of this Agreement, after receipt of a written request by any other Co-Tenant, execute and deliver to such other Co-Tenant and such Co-Tenant's Financing Parties, as designated in such request, such estoppel certificates and consents as may be reasonably requested thereby. 17.2.2 Pledge, Collateral Assignment or Encumbrance . Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, to the extent a Co-Tenant pledges, collaterally assigns or encumbers its Undivided Interest and its rights under this Agreement as provided above, the Co-Tenants expressly agree among themselves and for the benefit of any Financing Parties that (a) upon the occurrence of a default by a Co-Tenant hereunder, any non-defaulting Co-Tenant declaring the default shall also provide written notice to the defaulting Co-Tenant's Financing Parties (of which the Parties have notice) of such default (and accept such Financing Parties' cure of such default), and (b) each Financing Party shall have the same period after receipt of such notice of default as is given to the defaulting Co-Tenant under this Agreement to cure, or cause to be cured, the default described therein, plus, in each instance, the following additional time periods: (i) 30 days in the event of any monetary default; and (ii) 60 days in the event of any non-monetary default. The Co-Tenants agree that no Financing Party shall be obligated to perform any obligation or be deemed to incur any liability or obligation provided in this Agreement on any Co-Tenant's part or shall have any obligation or liability to any Co-Tenant with respect to this Agreement except to the extent any Financing Party has assumed such Co-Tenant's obligations under this Agreement. 17.2.3 Financing Costs and Expenses . All reasonable costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees and expenses, incurred by the Manager or any Co-Tenant in connection with the actual or proposed pledge, collateral assignment, encumbrance, or grant of a security interest in another Co-Tenant's Undivided Interest and its rights under this Agreement to a Financing Party, shall be paid or reimbursed by the assigning/borrowing Co-Tenant upon request therefor from the Manager and the respective Co-Tenants. 17.3 Reservation of Rights . Except as otherwise set forth herein, Pumpjack reserves all rights in the Shared Facilities not otherwise expressly granted to Bravo I or Bravo II herein. 17.4 Governing Law . This Agreement is governed by the Laws of the State of New York. Each Party hereby irrevocably and unconditionally submits to the exclusive jurisdiction of any state court or federal court of the United States of America, in either case sitting in the Borough of Manhattan of the City of New York, New York, and irrevocably waives, to the fullest extent permitted by Law, any objection to the laying of venue of any suit, action or proceedings with respect to this Agreement brought in any such court, and further irrevocably waives, to the fullest extent permitted by Law, any claim that any such suit, action or proceedings brought in any such court has been brought in any inconvenient forum. By execution and delivery of this Agreement and such other documents executed in connection herewith, each Party (i) irrevocably agrees to be bound by any final judgment (after any and all appeals) of any such court with respect to this Agreement and such documents, (ii) agrees that service of process in any such action may be effected by mailing a copy thereof by registered or certified mail (or any substantially similar form of mail), postage prepaid, to such Party at its address set forth in this Agreement, or at such other address of which the other Parties have been notified, and (iii) agrees that nothing herein will affect the right to effect service of process in any other manner permitted by Law or limit the right to bring any suit, action or proceeding in any other jurisdiction IN ADDITION, EACH PARTY HEREBY WAIVES, TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, ANY RIGHT IT MAY HAVE TO A TRIAL BY JURY IN RESPECT OF ANY LITIGATION DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY ARISING OUT OF, UNDER OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT. 17.5 Compliance with Laws . This Agreement is subject to all present and future Laws, including valid orders, rules and regulations of any Governmental Authority having jurisdiction over the Shared Facilities, the Projects, or the Parties. 17.6 Attorneys' Fees . The prevailing party in any action relating to or arising out of this Agreement shall be entitled to recover all reasonable fees and costs, including reasonable attorneys' fees and expenses, incurred in the course of such action. 17.7 Survival . Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, the provisions of this Section 17.7 (Survival), Section 2.16.2 (Right to Terminate in Event of Failure to Close by Outside Date), Article 4 (Shared Expenses), Section 6.14 (Withdrawal of a Co-Tenant), Section 7.5 (Obligations at End of Term or Upon Removal or Resignation), Article 11 (Indemnification), Article 13 (Confidentiality), Section 14.4 (Remedies Cumulative), Section 14.6 (Limitation of Liability), Article 15, Section 17.4 (Governing Law), Section 17.14 (Non-Recourse), and Exhibit I (Dispute Resolution) are intended to and shall survive termination of this Agreement so as to cover all claims instituted within the period set forth in the applicable statute of limitations. 17.8 Effect of Waiver . The Parties agrees that no failure or delay by a Party in exercising any right, power or privilege under this Agreement shall operate as a waiver thereof, unless such waiver is made expressly and confirmed in writing by the Party against whom such waiver would be enforced, nor shall any single or partial exercise by a Party of any right, power or privilege hereunder preclude any other or future exercise thereof. 17.9 Severability . Any provision of this Agreement that is prohibited or unenforceable in any jurisdiction shall, as to that jurisdiction, be ineffective to the extent of that prohibition or unenforceability without invalidating the remaining provisions hereof or affecting the validity or enforceability of that provision in any other jurisdiction. 17.10 Entire Agreement; Amendments . This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties pertaining to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior agreements, representations, communications and understandings, written or oral, express or implied, pertaining thereto. Any modifications, amendments, or changes to this Agreement shall be binding upon the Parties only if agreed upon in writing and signed by the authorized representatives of all of the Parties and shall be subject to any requisite Governmental Approvals. 17.11 Not for the Benefit of Third Parties . This Agreement is intended to be solely for the benefit of the Parties and their respective successors and permitted assignees, and is not intended to and shall not confer any rights or benefits on any party not a signatory hereto. 17.12 Counterparts . This Agreement may be executed in a number of identical counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument. A copy of this Agreement signed by a Party and delivered by facsimile transmission to the other Parties shall have the same effect as the delivery of an original of this Agreement containing the original signature of such first-mentioned Party. 17.13 Further Assurances . Each Party agrees to provide such information, execute and deliver any instruments and documents, and to take such other and further actions as may be necessary or reasonably requested by the other Parties, to the extent not inconsistent with the provisions of this Agreement and not involving assumptions of obligations or materially affecting the cost of performance provided for in this Agreement, in order to give full effect to this Agreement and to carry out the intent of this Agreement. 17.14 Non-Recourse . Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, no Party shall have any claims, obligations, liabilities or causes of action (whether in contract or tort, in law or in equity, or granted by statute, including those that may be available to avoid or disregard the entity form of a Party) with respect to or arising out of the transactions contemplated by this Agreement against (a) any member or any other present or future holder (whether direct or indirect) of any equity interests in a Party, (b) any of their respective affiliates (other than a Party) or (c) any officers, directors, managers, employees, representatives, executives or agents of any of the foregoing, such claims, obligations, liabilities and causes of action, to the maximum extent permitted by law, being expressly waived. 17.15 Successors and Assigns . Subject to the restrictions on Transfer set forth in this Agreement, this Agreement will be binding on, and inure to the benefit of, the Parties and their successors and permitted assigns. 17.16 Memorandum . Concurrently with execution and delivery of this Agreement, the Parties will execute and deliver a Memorandum of Co-Tenancy and Shared Facilities Agreement in the form attached hereto as Exhibit J, which Memorandum of Co-Tenancy and Shared Facilities Agreement will promptly thereafter be recorded in the official records of Kern County, California. Upon or promptly after termination of this Agreement with respect to any Party, such Party will execute and deliver a notice of termination of this Agreement with respect to such Party promptly upon request by any other Party for recording in the official records of Kern County, California. 17.17 Interpretation . 17.17.1 Headings . The titles, captions and headings in this Agreement are inserted for convenience only and will not be used for the purposes of construing or interpreting this Agreement. 17.17.2 References in this Agreement . In this Agreement, unless a clear, contrary intention appears: (a) the singular includes the plural and vice versa; (b) reference to any Person includes such Person's successors and assigns but, in the case of a Party, only if such assigns are permitted by this Agreement, and reference to a Person in a particular capacity excludes such Person in any other capacity; (c) pronouns and reference to any gender includes each other gender; (d) reference to any agreement (including this Agreement), document or instrument means such agreement, document or instrument as amended or modified and in effect from time to time in accordance with the terms thereof and, if applicable, the terms of this Agreement; (e) reference to any Law means such Law as amended, modified, codified or reenacted, in whole or in part, and in effect from time to time, including, if applicable, rules and regulations promulgated thereunder; (f) reference to any Section means such Section of this Agreement, and references in any Section or definition to any clause means such clause of such Section or definition; (g) "hereunder," "hereof," "hereto" and words of similar import will be deemed references to this Agreement as a whole and not to any particular Section or other provision of this Agreement; (h) "including" (and with correlative meaning "include") means including without limitation; (i) relative to the determination of any period of time, "from" means "from and including", "to" means "to but excluding" and "through" means "through and including"; and (j) references to "or" shall be deemed to be disjunctive but not necessarily exclusive (i.e., unless the context dictates otherwise, "or" shall be interpreted to mean "and/or" rather than "either/or"). 17.17.3 Industry Meanings . Words and abbreviations not defined in this Agreement that have well-known technical or power industry meanings in the United States are used in this Agreement in accordance with those recognized meanings. 17.17.4 Joint Responsibility for Drafting . This Agreement was negotiated and prepared by the Parties with advice of counsel to the extent deemed necessary by each Party. The Parties have agreed to the wording of this Agreement, and none of the provisions of this Agreement will be construed against one Party on the ground that such Party is the author of this Agreement or any part of this Agreement. 17.17.5 Incorporation of Exhibits . The Exhibits attached to this Agreement are incorporated into this Agreement by reference for all purposes. [Signature page follows]

Shared Facilities "Shared Facilities" herein shall mean those mechanical, structural and electrical/telecommunication components supporting the common conveyance of energy flow from the point of common coupling of the three (3) Co-Tenants. Refer to Figure 1 for the high level single line diagram for visual representation and equipment identification. Provided that one or both of Bravo I or Bravo II achieves the Closing Date, the Shared Facilities will be owned by the Co-Tenants in the respective percentage interests specified in Exhibit E. Referring to Figure 1, the Shared Facilities begin with the 115 kV common bus arrangement that is located on the high-side (115 kV) of the Projects' disconnect switch, circuit breaker, Generator Step-up Transformer (GSU) and metering equipment. Equipment that is located between the 115 kV common bus arrangement and each Project is not considered part of the Shared Facilities. Each Project will have its own disconnect switch connecting to the 115 kV common bus in order to provide the independent isolation of each Project from the Shared Facilities and the "Tap" identified in Figure 1. The Shared Facilities include the 115 kV common bus, 115 kV conductor between the Point of Common Coupling and the "Tap", and one (1) SCADA switch. The Shared Facilities will also include the Shared Facilities Incremental Equipment and the Shared Telecommunications Equipment, subject to payment therefor by Bravo I and Bravo II in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement. SUBSTATION EASEMENT AGREEMENT THIS SUBSTATION EASEMENT AGREEMENT (this "Agreement") is made, dated and effective as of ______ ___, 2014 (the "Effective Date"), between Starrh & Starrh Cotton Growers, LP (together with his successors, assigns and heirs, "Grantor"), and Rio Bravo Solar ___, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company having an address of 5307 E. Mockingbird Ln, 7th Floor, Dallas, Texas 75206 ("Grantee"), and in connection herewith, Grantor and Grantee agree, covenant and contract as set forth in this Agreement. Grantor and Grantee are sometimes referred to in this Agreement as a "Party" or collectively as the "Parties". R E C I T A L S A. Grantor owns certain real property located in Kern County, State of California, described on Exhibit A, attached hereto and by this reference made a part hereof (the "Premises"). B. Grantor previously entered into that certain Lease and Easement Agreement, by and between Grantor and Pumpjack Solar I, LLC ("Lessee"), as more particularly described on Exhibit B attached hereto and by this reference made a part hereof (as amended and/or restated, the "Lease"), pursuant to which Grantor leased the Premises to Lessee, on which Premises Lessee anticipates constructing, owning and operating a 20 megawatt solar photovoltaic electric generation facility. Within the Premises is certain real property as described on Exhibit C, attached hereto and by this reference made a part hereof (the "Substation Easement Area"), wherein, in connection with Lessee's generating facility, Lessee anticipates constructing, owning and operating an electrical substation and related infrastructure. C. Grantee holds an interest in certain leases, easements and other rights and interests in certain land situated in Kern County, California (the "Project Area"), as more particularly described on Exhibit D attached hereto, upon which Grantee desires to construct and operate a ____ megawatt solar photovoltaic electric generating facility (the "Grantee's Project"). D. Lessee and Grantee [are parties to/anticipate executing and delivering promptly after the date hereof] that certain Co-Tenancy and Shared Facilities Agreement dated [*], 2014 by and among Lessee, Grantee and the other signatories thereto (the "Shared Facilities Agreement"), pursuant to which, among other provisions, Lessee and Grantee have agreed to certain conditions and parameters of their respective uses of the Substation Easement Area. E. Grantee desires to obtain certain easements and associated rights over a portion of the Premises, including the Substation Easement Area, and Grantor desires to grant such easement and rights, on the terms and conditions set forth herein. NOW, THEREFORE, for Ten Dollars and No/100 ($10.00), the consideration of the mutual obligations and covenants of the Parties herein contained, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby mutually acknowledged, the Parties hereto agree as follows: 1. Grant of Easements. (a) Grant. (i) Transmission Easement. Grantor hereby grants, conveys, transfers and warrants to Grantee and its respective employees, contractors, subcontractors, agents, successors and assigns, for the Term of this Agreement, a non-exclusive easement (the "Transmission Easement") on, over, under and across the Substation Easement Area for the purposes of constructing, erecting, installing, using, replacing, relocating, reconstructing and removing from time to time, and monitoring, improving, maintaining, storing, repairing and operating, all in accordance with the terms and subject to the conditions of the Shared Facilities Agreement, the following: (a) underground or overhead electrical distribution, transmission and communications facilities, including without limitation overhead or underground transmission, lines, wires, and cables, support towers or poles, together with related conduit, footings, foundations, cross-arms, guy wires, anchors, circuit breakers, electric transformers, and (b) overhead and underground control, communications, and radio relay systems and telecommunications equipment, including without limitation fiber, wires, cables, conduit and poles, all for the transmission of electrical energy and/or for communication purposes, and all necessary and proper appliances and fixtures for use in connection with said lines (the foregoing collectively being referred to herein as the "Project Interconnection Facilities") together with the right to perform all other ancillary activities normally associated with such a facility as may be necessary or appropriate to service the Project Interconnection Facilities within the Substation Easement Area. (ii) Substation Easement. If and only to the extent same has not being performed(or is not being performed) by Lessee, Grantor hereby grants, conveys, transfers and warrants to Grantee and its respective employees, contractors, subcontractors, agents, successors and assigns, for the Term of the Agreement, a non-exclusive easement ("Substation Easement") on, over, under and across the Substation Easement Area for purposes of, and in any event all in accordance with the terms and subject to the conditions of the Shared Facilities Agreement: constructing, erecting, installing, using, replacing, relocating, reconstructing and removing from time to time, and monitoring, improving, maintaining, storing, repairing, operating, and making connections to the following: electrical substation facilities, including without limitation transformers, interconnection and switching facilities, foundations, footings and concrete pads, towers, poles, cross-arms, guy lines, and anchors, vaults, cabinets, conduit, fiber, cables, wires and other conductors ("Substation Facilities"), related Project Interconnection Facilities, water lines, sanitary sewer lines, storm sewers, gas lines, gates and fences, together with the right to perform all other ancillary activities normally associated with such a facility as may be necessary or appropriate to service the Substation Facilities within the Substation Easement Area. (iii) Access Easement. Grantor hereby grants, conveys, transfers and warrants to Grantee and its respective employees, contractors, subcontractors, agents, successors and assigns, for the Term of the Agreement, a non-exclusive easement ("Access Easement") on, over, under and across the Substation Easement Area, and on, over, under and across any and all vehicular and pedestrian access routes to and from the Substation Easement Area as may be designated by Lessee for Grantee's use from time to time, for purposes of, all in accordance with the terms and subject to the conditions of the Shared Facilities Agreement: accessing the Substation Easement Area; exercising the rights granted in this Agreement; and installing, constructing, operating, maintaining, repairing, replacing, relocating, removing or inspecting the Project Interconnection Facilities. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Grantee's access rights to and over the Substation Easement Area pursuant to this Access Easement or any of the other Easements (as below defined) for the initial installation and subsequent maintenance repair and replacement activities related to the Project Interconnection Facilities shall be limited to just such portions of said Substation Easement Area as required for such installation, maintenance, repair and replacement activities and shall not include access to areas solely used in connection with the operation of the solar photovoltaic electric generation facility being developed and operated by Lessee (the "Pumpjack Facility Areas"), if any. Any access to such Pumpjack Facility Areas by Grantee shall require the prior consent of Lessee pursuant to the terms of the Shared Facilities Agreement. (iv) Construction and Maintenance Easement. To accommodate the construction, maintenance, replacement, and repair of the Project Interconnection Facilities and Substation Facilities, Grantee and their respective employees, contractors, subcontractors and agents may, to the extent any such activities do not adversely affect Lessee's facilities located thereon or Lessee's use and operation of such facilities, and all in accordance with the terms and subject to the conditions of the Shared Facilities Agreement, make reasonable, temporary use of the portion of the Premises that is fifty (50) feet on either side of the Substation Easement Area (collectively with the Transmission Easement, the Substation Easement, and the Access Easement, sometimes herein called the "Easements"). (b) Title to Transmission Facilities and Substation Facilities. Grantee (and/or others to which Grantee shall assign or convey rights or an interest under this Agreement as may be expressly permitted under the terms and conditions of the Shared Facilities Agreement) shall at all times retain title to the Project Interconnection Facilities and Substation Facilities and shall have the right to remove them (or to allow them to be removed by an authorized third party) from the Substation Easement Area at any time, subject to any applicable conditions regarding same as set forth in the Shared Facilities Agreement. Grantor shall have no ownership, lien, security or other interest in or to any Project Interconnection Facilities or Substation Facilities. Nothing in this Agreement, however, shall be construed as requiring Grantee to construct, install or operate the Project Interconnection Facilities, the Substation Facilities or exercise the rights granted under any of the Easements. (c) Easements In Gross. The Easements and other rights granted by Grantor in this Agreement are EASEMENTS IN GROSS for the benefit of Grantee, and its respective successors and assigns, there being no real property benefiting from the easements and other rights granted in this Agreement, such easements and other rights being independent of any other lands or estates or interests in lands. 2. Term. (a) Term. The term of this Agreement shall be thirty-four and one half (34.5) years (the "Term"), subject to rights of termination set forth in this Paragraph 2. (b) Grantee Termination. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary set forth in this Agreement, Grantee shall have the right at any time to terminate this Agreement and all of the rights, duties and obligations of the Parties under this Agreement, effective upon thirty (30) days' prior written notice given by Grantee to Grantor. In the event this Agreement is terminated by Grantee in accordance with this paragraph, Grantor authorizes Grantee to execute and record a notice of termination evidencing such termination. No termination of this Agreement pursuant to this paragraph shall be effective unless a notice of termination has been executed and recorded in accordance with this paragraph. (c) Grantor Termination. In the event initial construction of the Project Interconnection Facilities or Substation Facilities on the Substation Easement Area has not commenced within seven (7) years after the Effective Date, this Agreement and all of the rights, duties and obligations of the Parties under this Agreement may be terminated by Grantor upon thirty (30) days' prior written notice by Grantor to Grantee given on or before ninety (90) days after expiration of such seven (7) year period. In the event this Agreement is terminated by Grantor in accordance with this paragraph, Grantor and Grantee shall thereafter execute and record a notice of termination evidencing such termination. No termination of this Agreement pursuant to this paragraph shall be effective unless a notice of termination has been executed and recorded in accordance with this paragraph. The right of Grantor to terminate this Agreement pursuant to this paragraph shall be Grantor's sole and exclusive remedy in the event Grantee elects not to construct the Project Interconnection Facilities or Substation Facilities on the Substation Easement Area. (d) Automatic Termination. This Agreement shall terminate automatically and without the necessity for further notice in the event that the "Pumpjack Consent" (as defined in Section 3(f) herein below) has not been recorded on or before March 31, 2022. (e) Removal Upon Termination. Upon termination of this Agreement under this Paragraph 2, and at the written request of Grantor, Grantee shall promptly remove all of Grantee's Project Interconnection Facilities and, provided same are no longer being used by Lessee or any other party entitled to use same, the Substation Facilities, within the Substation Easement Area, and where removed from the ground to no less than the greater of (i) eighteen (18) inches below the surface of the land, or (ii) the depth required by applicable law. Grantee shall have a continuing easement to enter and access the Substation Easement Area for purposes described in this paragraph; provided, however, that Grantee's obligations under this paragraph shall survive the termination hereof for a period of twelve (12) months. 3. Grantor's Representations, Warranties and Covenants. Grantor hereby represents, warrants and covenants as follows: (a) Grantor's Authority. Grantor is the sole owner of the Premises, has good and indefeasible title to the Premises, and, subject to the rights of Lessee under the terms of the Pumpjack Lease, has the unrestricted right and authority to execute this Agreement and to grant Grantee the rights granted in this Agreement. Grantee shall have the right to quietly and peaceably hold, possess and enjoy the Easements, subject to the terms and conditions hereof, for the Term of this Agreement, without hindrance, and Grantor shall defend Grantee's right of use and occupancy to the same against the claims of all persons. When executed by Grantor, this Agreement constitutes a valid and binding agreement enforceable against Grantor in accordance with its terms. (b) No Interference. Subject to the Lease, the Pumpjack Consent and the terms of the Shared Facilities Agreement, Grantor shall not, nor allow any other party claiming by or through Grantor to, (i) interfere with, Grantee's use of the Substation Easement Area for the purposes described in this Agreement, or Grantee's rights under this Agreement, (ii) affect the lateral support or structural soundness of the Project Interconnection Facilities and Substation Facilities; (iii) create an unsafe condition; or (iv) disrupt in any manner the use of the Project Interconnection Facilities or Substation Facilities by Grantee for the transmission of electric power. Without limiting the foregoing, Grantor shall not, within the Substation Easement Area: erect or install any buildings, structures, paved roadways, tanks, antennas or other improvements; place or store flammable materials; plant trees; place water, sewer or drainage facilities; or alter the elevation of the ground surface. (c) Cooperation. Grantor shall assist and fully cooperate with Grantee (including signing in Grantor's name, if necessary) in applying for, complying with or obtaining any land use permits and approvals, building permits, environmental reviews, or any other permits, licenses, approvals or consents required for the financing, construction, installation, replacement, relocation, maintenance, repair, operation or removal of the Project Interconnection Facilities, the Substation Facilities and any other improvements made by Grantee and permitted in this Agreement, all at no out of pocket expense to Grantor. Grantor shall take no actions (i) that would cause the Project Interconnection Facilities or Substation Facilities to fail to comply with any applicable laws, rules, regulations, permits, approvals or consents of any governmental authority having jurisdiction over the Substation Easement Area, or (ii) in opposition to any of the foregoing, directly or indirectly. (d) Liens. Except for the Lease, as disclosed in the official land title records office of the county in which the Premises is located (the "Records Office"), or as otherwise disclosed in writing by Grantor to Grantee prior to the Effective Date, Grantor's fee simple title to the Premises is free and clear of all liens, encumbrances, easements, leases, mortgages, deeds of trust, security interests, mineral, oil or gas rights, rights of first refusal, options to purchase, contracts, wind development rights, claims and disputes (collectively, "Liens"). Grantee shall be entitled to obtain, and Grantor shall fully cooperate with and assist Grantee in obtaining, a subordination agreement, non-disturbance agreement or other appropriate agreement from each party holding a Lien that might interfere with Grantee's rights under this Agreement, at no out of pocket expense to Grantor. (e) Leasehold. Grantor hereby expressly agrees and acknowledges that this Agreement, and the Easements created hereunder, shall not reduce or impair Lessee's right, title or interest in and to the Lease or the interests created thereunder or Lessee's use of or access to or across any portion(s) of the Premises other than with respect to the Substation Easement Area pursuant to the terms and conditions of the Shared Facilities Agreement. 4. Grantee's Representations, Warranties and Covenants. Grantee hereby represents, warrants and covenants as follows: (a) Grantee's Authority. Grantee has the unrestricted right and authority to execute this Agreement. Each person signing this Agreement on behalf of Grantee is authorized to do so. When executed by Grantee, this Agreement constitutes a valid and binding agreement enforceable against Grantee in accordance with its terms. (b) Grantee's and Lessee's Access to Easement Area. Grantee hereby expressly agrees and acknowledges that this Agreement, and the Easements created hereunder, shall not reduce or impair Lessee's right, title or interest in and to the Lease, the interests created thereunder or Lessee's use of or access to or across any portion(s) of the Premises pursuant to the Lease, other than the Substation Easement Area, and with respect to the Substation Easement Area only as set forth in the Shared Facilities Agreement. 5. Default; Remedies. If a Party (the "Defaulting Party") fails to perform an obligation under this Agreement (an "Event of Default") such Defaulting Party shall not be in default of the terms of this Agreement if, (a) in the case of the failure to pay when due any amounts payable under this Agreement (a "Monetary Default") the Defaulting Party pays the past due amount within forty-five (45) days after receiving written notice of the Event of Default (a "Notice of Default") from the other Party (the "Non-Defaulting Party"), and (b) in the case of an Event of Default other than a Monetary Default (a "Non-Monetary Default"), the Event of Default is cured within ninety (90) days after receiving the Notice of Default; provided, that if the nature of the Non-Monetary Default requires, in the exercise of commercially reasonable diligence, more than ninety (90) days to cure then the Defaulting Party shall not be in default as long as it commences performance of the cure within ninety (90) days and thereafter pursues such cure with commercially reasonable diligence. Should an Event of Default remain uncured by the Defaulting Party the Non-Defaulting Party shall have and shall be entitled to at its option and without further notice, but subject to the limitations set forth in the last sentence of this paragraph, to exercise any remedy available at law or equity, including, without limitation, a suit for specific performance of any obligations set forth in this Agreement or any appropriate injunctive or other equitable relief, or for damages resulting from such default (including, without limitation, the cost of obtaining alternative easements and removing and reinstalling the Project Interconnection Facilities or Substation Facilities). Both Parties agree that remedies at law may be inadequate to protect against any actual or threatened breach of this Agreement. In the event of any breach or threatened breach, either Party shall have the right to apply for the entry of an immediate order to restrain or enjoin the breach and otherwise specifically to enforce the provisions of this Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, anything to the contrary contained in this Agreement, or any rights at law or in equity, in no event shall any default or breach of this Agreement, or any failure to perform any obligations under this Agreement, terminate, or entitle any Party to terminate, this Agreement or any of the Easements or rights granted hereunder. Without limiting the foregoing, no Party may terminate this Agreement, except as expressly described in Sections 2(b) and 2(c) of this Agreement. 6. Assignment; Lender Protections. In connection with Grantee's financing of the Grantee's Project, Grantee shall have the right, on an exclusive or non-exclusive basis, without obtaining the consent of Grantor to do any of the following with respect to all or any portion of this Agreement, the Easements, the Substation Easement Area, the Project Interconnection Facilities or the Substation Facilities, subject, in all cases, to the rights of the Lessee under the Lease (except as may be provided in the Pumpjack Consent) and to the terms and conditions of the Shared Facilities Agreement: encumber, hypothecate, mortgage, pledge, or otherwise finance Grantee's interests in this Agreement, the Easements and the Project Interconnection Facilities and Substation Facilities in favor of the holder of any mortgage, deed of trust or other security interest in this Agreement, the Easements, the Project Interconnection Facilities and Substation Facilities (each an "Easements Mortgagee"); grant co-easements, separate easements, sub-easements, licenses, leases, or similar rights (however denominated) to one or more persons or entities (each an "Assignee"); permit one or more Assignee(s) to attach wires, cables or conduits to the Project Interconnection Facilities or Substation Facilities, connect to the Substation Facilities, and hang or lay wire, cables and conduits within the Substation Easement Area; or sell, convey, lease, assign, mortgage, encumber, hypothecate or transfer to one or more Assignees or Easements Mortgagees any or all right or interest of Grantee in all or any portion of this Agreement, the Easements, the Substation Easement Area, the Project Interconnection Facilities or the Substation Facilities. Provided, however, and notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, any Assignee or Easements Mortgagee hereunder must be a person or entity to which Grantee shall have transferred all or part of its interest in the Shared Facilities Agreement and the "Shared Facilities" (as such term is defined in the Shared Facilities Agreement), strictly in accordance with and as expressly permitted by the Shared Facilities Agreement. Grantee shall notify Grantor in writing of any such assignment, mortgage, pledge or hypothecation and the name and address of any Assignee or Easement Mortgagee. Upon Grantee's assignment of its entire interest under this Agreement as to all or any portion of the Easements, or as may otherwise be provided in the applicable grant, sale, lease, conveyance or assignment document, Grantor shall recognize the Assignee as Grantee's proper successor, the Assignee shall have all of the assigned rights, benefits and obligations of Grantee under and pursuant to this Agreement, and Grantee shall be relieved of all of its obligations relating to the assigned interests under this Agreement that relate to acts or omissions which occur or accrue following the effective date of such grant, sale, lease, conveyance or assignment. Grantor shall notify Grantee in writing of any sale, assignment or transfer of any of Grantor's interest in the Substation Easement Area, or any part thereof. Until Grantee receives such notice, Grantee shall have no duty to any successor Grantor. If Grantee has provided notice to Grantor of an Easements Mortgagee, then: (a) Grantor and Grantee will not modify, cancel or terminate this Agreement without the prior written consent of the Easements Mortgagee; (b) upon any default by Grantee under this Agreement, Grantor shall concurrently deliver a copy of the applicable notice of default to Grantee and any Easements Mortgagee; (c) the Easements Mortgagee shall have the right, but not the obligation: (i) to do any act or thing required to be performed by Grantee under this Agreement, and any such act or thing performed by an Easements Mortgagee shall be as effective to prevent a default under this Agreement as if done by Grantee, and (ii) to cure any default under this Agreement; and (d) prior to exercising any right under this Agreement resulting from a default by Grantee, Grantor shall give any Easements Mortgagee the same time period as Grantee after receipt of notice of default to remedy the default, or cause the same to be remedied, plus, in each instance, the Easements Mortgagee shall have an additional time period of forty-five (45) days to complete such cure. An Easements Mortgagee shall have the right to exercise foreclosure proceedings or a power of sale or other remedy afforded in law or equity or by the security documents as to Grantee's interest in this Agreement, the Easements, the Substation Area or the Project Interconnection Facilities, and Grantee's interest in this Agreement, the Easements, the Substation Area or the Project Interconnection Facilities may be transferred, conveyed, or assigned to any purchaser, including Easements Mortgagee, at any such foreclosure sale. Easements Mortgagee will not be or become liable to Grantor as an assignee of Grantee's interest in this Agreement or otherwise unless it assumes such liability in writing or acquires such interest through foreclosure (or deed or other transfer in lieu of foreclosure). At the request of Grantee or the Easements Mortgagee, Grantor shall execute and deliver an acknowledgement, in a form agreeable to Easements Mortgagee and Grantee, that Grantee has hypothecated, mortgaged, or pledged all or any portion of Grantee's right, title, or interest in this Agreement, the Easements, the Substation Area or the Project Interconnection Facilities to the Easements Mortgagee and that Easements Mortgagee is entitled to all of the rights, benefits, and protections as an Easements Mortgagee under this Agreement. 7. Insurance. Grantee agrees at its own expense to have a general commercial liability insurance policy with a coverage limit of at least Two Million Dollars ($2,000,000.00) in effect during the Term to cover any personal injuries or accidents that may occur as a direct result of Grantee's activities on the Substation Easement Area (including any activities of any of Grantee's employees, consultants, contractors or other agents).
8. Indemnity. Grantee shall defend, indemnify and hold harmless Grantor and Grantor's Related Persons (as defined below) (each, an "Indemnified Party") from and against any and all claims, litigation, actions, proceedings, losses, damages, liabilities, obligations, costs and expenses, including attorneys', investigators' and consulting fees, court costs and litigation expenses (collectively, "Claims") suffered or incurred by such Indemnified Party, arising from (a) physical damage to the Indemnified Party's property (which in Grantor's case, shall include damage to crops and livestock), to the extent caused by the negligent acts and/or omissions of Grantee or any of its principals, officers, employees, representatives, or contractors (the "Grantee's Related Persons"), and (b) physical injuries or death to or of the Indemnified Party or the public, to the extent caused by the negligent acts and/or omissions of Grantee or any of the Grantee's Related Persons; provided, however, that in no event shall Grantee be responsible for defending, indemnifying or holding harmless any Indemnified Party to the extent of any Claim caused by, arising from or contributed to by the negligence or willful misconduct of such Indemnified Party or any of their principals, officers, employees, representatives, or contractors. The reference to property damage in this Paragraph 8 above does not include the following loss of: (a) timber; (b) rent; (c) business opportunities; (d) profits and the like that may result from Grantee's exercising its rights granted pursuant to this Agreement. The foregoing indemnity shall not extend to (i) property damage or personal injuries attributable to risks of known and unknown dangers associated with electrical generating facilities, such as electromagnetic fields or (ii) Grantee's lawful enforcement of its rights under this Agreement. As used herein the term "Grantor's Related Person" shall mean any principals, officers, employees, representatives, successors and/or assigns of Grantor and Lessee. Each Grantee shall be severally, but not jointly, liable to Grantor for its respective obligations under this paragraph.
9. Limitation on Rights. Notwithstanding anything in this Agreement to the contrary, Grantee acknowledges and agrees that it has no right to exercise any of the rights granted pursuant to the Easements or otherwise under the provisions of this Agreement unless and until Lessee executes and delivers for recording its consent to this Agreement and the Easements granted hereunder (the "Pumpjack Consent") in the form attached hereto as Exhibit E (or as may otherwise be agreed to by Lessee and Grantee), and subject to the terms and conditions set forth in such Pumpjack Consent; provided, however, that in the event Lessee's rights under the Lease are terminated or the Lease is no longer in effect, Grantee may exercise its rights granted pursuant to this Agreement without the need to obtain or receive the Pumpjack Consent as described in this Paragraph 9. 10. Miscellaneous. (a) Confidentiality. To the fullest extent allowed by law, Grantor shall maintain in the strictest confidence, for the sole benefit of Grantee, all information pertaining to the financial terms of or payments under this Agreement, Grantee's site or product design, methods of operation, methods of construction, power production or availability of the Project Interconnection Facilities, power production, availability or configuration of the Substation Facilities, and the like, whether disclosed by Grantee or discovered by Grantor, unless such information either (i) is in the public domain by reason of prior publication through no act or omission of Grantor or its employees or agents, or (ii) was already known to Grantor at the time of disclosure and that Grantor is free to use or disclose without breach of any obligation to any person or entity. To the fullest extent permitted by law, Grantor shall not use such information for its own benefit, publish or otherwise disclose it to others, or permit its use by others for their benefit or to the detriment of Grantee. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Grantor may provide information as required or appropriate to attorneys, accountants, lenders, or third parties who may be assisting Grantor or with whom Grantor may be negotiating in connection with the Premises, Grantor's financial or other planning, or as may be necessary to enforce this Agreement. (b) Successors and Assigns. This Agreement shall inure to the benefit of and be binding upon Grantor and Grantee and, to the extent provided in any assignment or other transfer under Paragraph 6 hereof, any Assignee, and their respective heirs, transferees, successors and assigns, and all persons claiming under them, and shall be deemed covenants running with the land and be binding upon the Premises. (c) Recording of Agreement. The Parties shall cause the recordation of a duplicate original of this Agreement in the Records Office promptly after execution of this Agreement. Grantor hereby consents to the recordation of the interest of an Assignee in the Easements or this Agreement. (d) Notices. All notices or other communications required or permitted by this Agreement, including payments to Grantor, shall be in writing and shall be deemed given when personally delivered to Grantor or Grantee, or in lieu of such personal delivery services, five (5) days after deposit in the United States mail, first class, postage prepaid, certified, addressed as follows: If to Grantor: Starrh & Starrh Cotton Growers ___________________ ___________________ ___________________
If to Grantee: Rio Bravo Solar ___, LLC ___________________ ___________________ ___________________
Any Party may change its address for purposes of this paragraph by giving written notice of such change to the other parties in the manner provided in this paragraph. (e) Entire Agreement; Amendments. This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between Grantor and Grantee respecting its subject matter. Any agreement, understanding or representation between Grantor and Grantee respecting the Substation Easement Area, the Easements, or any other matter referenced in this Agreement not expressly set forth in this Agreement or the Shared Facilities Agreement or a subsequent writing signed by both Parties and consented to by Lessee is null and void. This Agreement shall not be modified or amended except in a writing signed by both Parties, provided, however, that no amendment or modification of this Agreement shall be effective against the Lessee or the Lessee's mortgagee unless consented to in writing by each such party. No purported modifications or amendments, including, without limitation, any oral agreement (even if supported by new consideration), course of conduct or absence of a response to a unilateral communication, shall be binding on either Party. Grantor shall cooperate with Grantee in amending this Agreement from time to time to include any provision that may be reasonably requested by Grantee (and, so long as the Lease remains in effect, consented to by Lessee) for the purpose of implementing the provisions contained in this Agreement or for the purpose of preserving the security interest of, or satisfying the request of, any Assignee or an Easements Mortgagee. (f) Legal Matters. This Agreement shall be governed by and interpreted in accordance with the laws of the state in which the Substation Easement Area is located. If the Parties are unable to resolve amicably any dispute arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, they agree that such dispute shall be resolved in the state courts located in any county in which any portion of the Premises is located. The Parties agree that any rule of construction to the effect that ambiguities are to be resolved in favor of either Party shall not be employed in the interpretation of this Agreement and is hereby waived. The prevailing party in any action or proceeding for the enforcement, protection or establishment of any right or remedy under this Agreement shall be entitled to recover its reasonable attorneys' fees and costs in connection with such action or proceeding from the non-prevailing party. (g) Partial Invalidity. Should any provision of this Agreement be held, in a final and unappealable decision by a court of competent jurisdiction, to be either invalid, void or unenforceable, the remaining provisions hereof shall remain in full force and effect, unimpaired by the holding. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, the parties agree that in no event shall the Term of this Agreement be longer than, respectively, the longest period permitted by applicable law. (h) Estoppel Certificates. Within ten (10) days after written request by Grantee or its Easements Mortgagee, Grantor shall execute and deliver to Grantee and/or its Easements Mortgagee an "Estoppel Certificate" (a) certifying that this Agreement is in full force and effect and has not been modified (or if modified stating with particularity the nature thereof), (b) certifying that there are no uncured events of default hereunder (or, if any uncured events of default exist, stating with particularity the nature thereof); and (c) containing any other certifications that may be reasonably requested by Grantee or its Easements Mortgagee. Any such certificates may be conclusively relied upon by Grantee, its Easements Mortgagee and any prospective Assignee or investor in Grantee. If Grantor fails to deliver any such certificate within such time, then Grantee may conclusively conclude and rely on the following: (i) this Agreement is in full force and effect and has not been modified, (ii) there are no uncured events of default by the Grantee hereunder, and (iii) the other certifications so requested are in fact true and correct. (i) Third Party Beneficiary. Grantor and Grantee hereby agree that Lessee and its successors and assigns shall be third party beneficiaries of this Agreement, which shall include, without limitation, Lessee having the right to enforce the terms of this Agreement upon the occurrence of (i) an Event of Default, (ii) the failure of Grantee to perform its obligations hereunder, or (iii) any other violation(s) of any of the terms and provisions hereof. (j) No Merger. There shall be no merger of the Easements, or of the easement estate created by this Agreement, with the fee estate in the Premises by reason of the fact that the Easements or the easement estate or any interest therein may be held, directly or indirectly, by or for the account of any person or persons who shall own the fee estate or any interest therein, and no such merger shall occur unless and until all persons at the time having an interest in the fee estate in the Premises and all persons (including, without limitation, Easements Mortgagee) having an interest in the Easements or in the estate of Grantor and Grantee shall join in a written instrument effecting such merger and shall duly record the same. (k) Joint Grantors. If one or more persons, partnerships, corporations, trusts or other entities execute this Agreement as Grantor or have an ownership interest in the Premises from time to time, the obligations of Grantor under this Agreement shall be the joint and several obligations of each such person, partnership, corporation, trust or other entity. Except as stated to the contrary herein, all such persons, partnerships, corporations, trusts or other entities agree that they shall be solely responsible for allocating any payments made under this Agreement between or among themselves and that Grantee shall have no obligation to make any allocation. (l) No Partnership. Nothing contained in this Agreement shall be deemed or construed by the Parties or by any third person to create the relationship of principal and agent, partnership, joint venture or any other association between Grantor and Grantee. (m) Headings. The headings of the paragraphs of this Agreement are not a part of this Agreement and shall have no effect upon the construction or interpretation of any part thereof. (n) Counterparts. This Agreement, and any amendment hereto, may be executed in any number of counterparts and by each Party on separate counterparts with the same effect as if all signatory parties had signed the same document, each of which when so executed and delivered shall be deemed an original and all of which taken together shall constitute one and the same instrument. (o) Eminent Domain. If all or any portion of the Easements is taken by, or conveyed to, any governmental or quasi-governmental entity as a result of an eminent domain proceeding, then nothing herein shall affect the right of Grantee to receive compensation or damages for any losses that it suffers as a result thereof, including the loss of Project Interconnection Facilities, Substation Facilities or electric transmission capacity as a result of that eminent domain proceeding, so long as any such award to Grantee does not diminish any award to Grantor and/or Lessee. Both Grantor and Grantee shall have the right to pursue their respective claims for damages in connection with any eminent domain proceeding.

Pumpjack Solar I, LLC ("Lessee") is the lessee and holder of certain leasehold interests in and to the Premises, such Premises as further described on Exhibit A attached hereto and incorporated as if fully set forth herein, and pursuant to the lease, which is more particularly described in Exhibit B attached to the Agreement (the "Lease"), on which Lessee [intends to construct, own and operate/has constructed and owns and operates] a solar photovoltaic energy project with a nameplate capacity not to exceed 20 MW (the "Pumpjack Project"). Lessee has executed this Consent to confirm, subject to the provisions set forth in this Consent, its consent and approval of the grant to Grantee of the Easements provided by the Agreement and to all terms and conditions of the Agreement. Grantee's rights and interest under the Agreement shall continue in full force and effect and shall not by operation of law or otherwise be terminated or disturbed, except in accordance with the terms of this Agreement and this Consent. This Consent is being executed in connection with Rio Bravo ___ executing its Option (as such term is defined in the Shared Facilities Agreement) and is being provided in connection with the closing of the purchase by Rio Bravo ___ of its "Undivided Interest" under the terms of the Shared Facilities Agreement. This Consent is being given in order to allow Grantee to exercise its rights granted under the Agreement, but in all events subject to the applicable terms and conditions of the Shared Facilities Agreement, including without limitation the terms and conditions governing the use of the "Shared Facilities" and the "Shared Premises", as such terms are defined in the Shared Facilities Agreement. In the event of any conflict or any inconsistency between the terms of this Consent and the Shared Facilities Agreement, the terms of the Shared Facilities Agreement shall control. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary or seemingly to the contrary in this paragraph or elsewhere in the Agreement: (1) Neither Lessee nor Grantee shall utilize the Substation Easement Area in a way that materially interferes with the other party's ongoing rights to use the Substation Easement Area. (2) Lessee and Grantee agree at all times to use commercially reasonable efforts to cooperate with each other in a commercially reasonable way to avoid materially interfering with the other party's rights to use the Substation Easement Area. (3) Lessee shall continue to retain the right to use the Substation Easement Area for the following purposes:
(A) constructing, installing, using, replacing, relocating, reconstructing and removing from time to time, and monitoring, maintaining, repairing and operating the following: underground or above-ground electrical distribution, transmission and communications lines, electric transformers, and telecommunications equipment, for the transmission of electrical energy and/or for communication purposes, and all necessary and proper appliances and fixtures for use in connection with said lines (the foregoing collectively being referred to herein as the "Pumpjack Project Interconnection Facilities") together with the right to perform all other ancillary activities normally associated with such a facility as may be necessary or appropriate to service the Pumpjack Project Interconnection Facilities; (B) for access on, over, under and across the Substation Easement Area, and on, over, under and across any and all access routes to and from the Substation Easement Area, in order to: conduct any studies, tests or inspections that Lessee deems necessary, including, without limitation, surveys, soil sampling, environmental tests, archeological assessments, and transmission and interconnection studies; (C) to construct and maintain roadways to provide access to and across the substation Easement Area for the purposes stated in subparagraphs (A) and (B) immediately above, for purposes ancillary to the Lease, and for the purpose of installing, constructing, operating, maintaining, repairing, replacing, relocating, removing or inspecting the Pumpjack Project Interconnection Facilities, so long as any such roadway does not materially interfere with Grantee's rights (consistent with the terms and provisions of the Shared Facilities Agreement) to use the Substation Easement Area for the purposes granted in the Easements; and (D) such other use or purpose permitted by the Lease so long as such use or purpose does not materially interfere with Grantee's rights (consistent with the terms and provisions of the Shared Facilities Agreement) to use the Substation Easement Area for the purposes granted in the Easements. Grantee further agrees that Lessee and its successors and assigns shall be third party beneficiaries of the indemnification obligation of Grantee set forth in Section 8 of the Agreement and such provisions are incorporated into this Consent by this reference. In the event of the expiration or sooner termination of the Lease, Grantee shall consent and shall agree, subject to the terms of this Consent, to provide rights to Lessee equivalent to Lessee's rights under this Consent and the Agreement to any new lease or easement granted in connection with the use or operation of the Pumpjack Project Interconnection Facilities and Substation Facilities on the Substation Easement Area or otherwise comprising a part of the facilities being installed by Lessee or its successors and assigns from time to time. Although such provisions shall be self-operative, upon the request of Lessee or its successors and assigns, Grantee and its successors and assigns shall enter into appropriate agreements to confirm such provision of equivalent rights. This Consent shall inure to the benefit of and be binding upon Lessee and Grantee and their respective heirs, transferees, successors and assigns, and all persons claiming under them, and shall be deemed covenants running with the land and be binding upon their respective interests in the Substation Easement Area. Form of Bill of Sale - Shared Facilities BILL OF SALE - SHARED FACILITIES THIS BILL OF SALE - SHARED FACILITIES (this "Bill of Sale") is effective as of [?] (the "Effective Date"), between PUMPJACK SOLAR I, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company ("Seller"), and [Buyer], a Delaware limited liability company ("Buyer"). Seller and Buyer are sometimes referred to in this Bill of Sale individually as a "Party" and collectively as the "Parties". RECITALS: A. Pumpjack is developing a solar photovoltaic electricity generating facility with a rated capacity of 20 MW on a site near McKittrick, California (the "Pumpjack Project"). B. Buyer is developing a solar photovoltaic electricity generating facility with a rated capacity of 20 MW on a site in the general vicinity of the Pumpjack Project. C. Pumpjack will design, construct, and own a generator interconnection line and other associated facilities connecting the Pumpjack Project to the transmission system owned by Pacific Gas and Electric Company and controlled by the California Independent System Operator Corporation. A portion of such interconnection facilities, including the 115 kV common bus, SCADA switch, and a short span of conductor, all as more particularly identified in Exhibit C to the Co-Tenancy Agreement (as hereinafter defined) as the "Shared Facilities," shall be shared among the Co-Tenants. D. Seller and Buyer are parties to a Co-Tenancy and Shared Facilities Agreement dated as of [*], 2014 (such agreement, as amended and supplemented from time to time, the "Co-Tenancy Agreement"), under which Seller has granted to Buyer an option to acquire an "Undivided Interest" in the Shared Facilities. E. Buyer has exercised such option, and Seller desires to sell to Buyer, and Buyer desires to purchase from Seller, such Undivided Interest in the Shared Facilities. NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing Recitals and the mutual obligations and covenants of the Parties herein contained, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby mutually acknowledged, the Parties hereto agree as follows: 1. Defined Terms. Defined terms used but not defined in this Bill of Sale will have the meanings given to such terms in the Co-Tenancy Agreement. 2. Conveyance of Shared Facilities by Seller and Purchase and Acceptance by Buyer. Seller hereby sells, transfers, conveys, assigns, grants, and delivers to Buyer, and Buyer hereby purchases, pays for, accepts and assumes all obligations and liabilities associated with, an Undivided Interest in the Shared Facilities, all on the terms and subject to the conditions set forth in the Co-Tenancy Agreement. 3. Conflicts with Co-Tenancy Agreement. This Bill of Sale is subject to the terms and conditions of the Co-Tenancy Agreement. The terms of the Co-Tenancy Agreement, including Seller's representations, warranties, covenants, agreements and indemnities relating to the Shared Facilities, are incorporated herein by this reference. Seller acknowledges and agrees that the representations, warranties, covenants, agreements and indemnities contained in the Co-Tenancy Agreement will not be superseded hereby but will remain in full force and effect to the full extent provided therein. In the event of any conflict between this Bill of Sale, on the one hand, and the Co-Tenancy Agreement, on the other hand, the Co-Tenancy Agreement will control. 4. Miscellaneous. 4.1 Entire Agreement; Amendments. This Bill of Sale consists of the terms and conditions set forth herein, as well as the Exhibits hereto, which are incorporated by reference herein and made a part hereof. This Bill of Sale sets forth the full and complete understanding of the Parties as of the Effective Date with respect to the subject matter hereof. This Bill of Sale will not be modified or amended except in a writing signed by both Parties and no purported modifications or amendments, including without limitation any oral agreement (even if supported by new consideration), course of conduct or absence of a response to a unilateral communication, will otherwise be binding on either Party. 4.2 Governing Law; Dispute Resolution. This Bill of Sale will be governed by and interpreted in accordance with the laws of the State of New York. If the Parties are unable to resolve amicably any dispute arising out of or in connection with this Bill of Sale, they agree that such dispute will be resolved in the manner provided in the Co-Tenancy Agreement. 4.3 No Partnership or Joint Venture. Nothing contained in this Bill of Sale will be deemed or construed by the Parties or by any third person to create the relationship of principal and agent, partnership, joint venture or any other association between or among them. 4.4 Partial Invalidity. Should any provision of this Bill of Sale be held, in a final and unappealable decision by a court of competent jurisdiction, to be either invalid, void or unenforceable, the remaining provisions hereof will remain in full force and effect, unimpaired by the holding. 4.5 Counterparts. This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, all of which will be considered one and the same agreement, and will become effective when one or more counterparts have been signed by each Party and delivered to the other Party. MEMORANDUM OF CO-TENANCY AND SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT
PARTIES: (1) PUMPJACK SOLAR I, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company; (2) RIO BRAVO SOLAR I, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company; (3) RIO BRAVO SOLAR II, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company; and (5) DUKE ENERGY RENEWABLE SERVICES, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company
