THIS MEMORANDUM OF CO-TENANCY AND SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT (this "Memorandum") is made and entered into effective as of [?] (the "Effective Date") by and among PUMPJACK SOLAR I, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company ("Pumpjack"), RIO BRAVO SOLAR I, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company ("Bravo I"), RIO BRAVO SOLAR II, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company ("Bravo II") (Bravo I and Bravo II are sometimes hereinafter referred to individually as a "Buyer," and collectively as the "Buyers"), and DUKE ENERGY RENEWABLE SERVICES, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (the "Manager") (Pumpjack, Bravo I, Bravo II, and the Manager, individually, a "Party," and collectively, the "Parties"). RECITALS: A. Pumpjack is developing a solar photovoltaic electricity generating facility with a rated capacity of 20 MW on a site near McKittrick, California (the "Pumpjack Project"). B. Bravo I is developing a solar photovoltaic electricity generating facility with a rated capacity of 20 MW on a site in the general vicinity of the Pumpjack Project (the "Bravo I Project"). C. Bravo II is developing a solar photovoltaic electricity generating facility with a rated capacity of 20 MW on a site in the general vicinity of the Pumpjack Project (the "Bravo II Project"). The Pumpjack Project, the Bravo I Project, and the Bravo II Project shall each be referred to as a "Project" and together as the "Projects." D. Pumpjack will design, construct, and own, on the land described in Exhibit A to this Memorandum (such land, the "Shared Premises") a generator interconnection line and other associated facilities connecting the Pumpjack Project to the transmission system owned by Pacific Gas and Electric Company and controlled by the California Independent System Operator Corporation. A portion of such interconnection facilities, including the 115 kV common bus, SCADA switch, and a short span of conductor, all as more particularly identified in Exhibit C to the Shared Facilities Agreement (as hereinafter defined) as the "Shared Facilities," shall be shared among the Co-Tenants. E. Pumpjack holds the leasehold and easement interests described on Exhibit D to the Shared Facilities Agreement with respect to the Shared Facilities, which leasehold and easement interests permit or allow access to and use of the Shared Facilities. F. Pumpjack and Buyer are parties to a Co-Tenancy and Shared Facilities Agreement dated as of [*] 20, 2014 (such agreement, as amended and supplemented from time to time, the "Shared Facilities Agreement"), under which, on the terms and subject to the conditions of the Shared Facilities Agreement, (i) Pumpjack has granted to Buyer an option to acquire an undivided interest in the Shared Facilities, including, on the terms and subject to the conditions of the Shared Facilities Agreement, an undivided interest in, and right to use, and have and hold certain easement, access and other rights with respect to, the Shared Facilities, (ii) the Parties have agreed to mutually beneficial limitations, restrictions, covenants and conditions for the proper and orderly ownership, operation and management of the interests of the Co-Tenants (as defined below) in the Shared Facilities, and (iii) the Parties have retained the Manager to operate and maintain the Shared Facilities. G. The Parties desire to record this Memorandum in order to provide record notice of the terms, covenants, conditions and provisions set forth in the Shared Facilities Agreement. Defined terms used but not otherwise defined herein will have the same meaning given to them in the Shared Facilities Agreement. Among the provisions of the Shared Facilities Agreement are the following: 1. Grant of Option. In the Shared Facilities Agreement, (a) Pumpjack grants to each Buyer, upon the terms and subject to the conditions contained in the Shared Facilities Agreement, an exclusive and irrevocable option (an "Option") to purchase an undivided interest as tenant in common in all right, title and interest of Pumpjack in and to the Shared Facilities (an "Undivided Interest"). After exercise of all of the Options, Pumpjack would retain for itself a one-third Undivided Interest. 2. Exercise of Option. A Buyer may exercise its Option in whole only and not in part. Any Option that is not exercised prior to December 31, 2020 (the "Option Deadline") will in any case be extinguished and of no further force or effect effective upon the Option Deadline. 3. Purchase and Sale. In the event a Buyer exercises its Option, Pumpjack will sell, convey, assign, transfer and deliver to such Buyer an Undivided Interest in the full amount of the Undivided Interest subject to such Option, on the terms and subject to the conditions contained in the Shared Facilities Agreement. Pumpjack's conveyance to a Buyer of an Undivided Interest will expressly include the right to use a percentage of the total capacity of the Shared Facilities that corresponds to such Undivided Interest. 4. Ownership of Undivided Interest in Shared Facilities. (a) Effective upon the ownership of an Undivided Interest, including by virtue of an acquisition by any Buyer of such Undivided Interests under the Shared Facilities Agreement, such Buyer will be deemed a "Co-Tenant" under the Shared Facilities Agreement with respect to such Undivided Interest and will be entitled to exercise its Shared Facilities use rights on the terms and subject to the conditions of the Shared Facilities Agreement. Prior to such acquisition of an Undivided Interest by a Buyer, such Buyer will not be entitled to any Shared Facilities use rights under the Shared Facilities Agreement. (b) Each Co-Tenant will own and hold its Undivided Interest in the Shared Facilities jointly with each other Co-Tenant, as a tenant-in-common, and without rights of survivorship, and shall have a right to use a Percentage Interest in the Shared Facilities that corresponds to such Undivided Interest (as defined in the Shared Facilities Agreement), all on the terms and subject to the conditions of the Shared Facilities Agreement,. (c) The Shared Facilities will be held and used solely to permit the transmission of electricity generated by or on behalf of each Co-Tenant (or by each Co-Tenant's successors, assigns or Affiliates) from the Projects through the Shared Facilities to the Point of Interconnection. Each Co-Tenant will have the right to hold and utilize its Undivided Interest solely for the benefit of its Project and solely to (a) connect its Project to the Shared Facilities to the extent of its Shared Facilities use rights and (b) deliver or receive electrical energy from or to its Project corresponding to such Shared Facilities use rights in accordance with the terms of the Shared Facilities Agreement. (d) Nothing contained in the Shared Facilities Agreement will be deemed, for U.S. federal, state or local tax purposes or for any other purpose, to constitute the creation of a partnership or joint venture among the Parties or to constitute the Parties as partners or joint venturers of one another. 5. Covenants Running with Land. The covenants of each Buyer made in the Shared Facilities Agreement will be deemed to be covenants running with and binding upon each Buyer's interest in the Shared Premises pursuant to applicable Law. 6. Waiver of Right to Partition. Each Party waives and relinquishes any and all rights that it may have to seek a partition or any other type of division of the Shared Facilities. 7. Term. The term of the Shared Facilities Agreement will begin on the Effective Date and will terminate on the first to occur of (a) the mutual agreement of all the Co-Tenants to terminate the Shared Facilities Agreement, or (b) termination of the Shared Facilities Agreement as otherwise provided therein. In addition, the Shared Facilities Agreement will terminate with respect to any Buyer if such Buyer's Option has not been exercised prior to the Option Deadline. 8. Assignment. No Party may sell, assign or otherwise transfer any of its rights or interests under the Shared Facilities Agreement, whether voluntarily or by operation of law, except as permitted by the Shared Facilities Agreement. 9. Governing Law. The terms and provisions of the Shared Facilities Agreement will be interpreted in accordance with the laws of the State of New York. 10. Purpose of Memorandum. The Parties have entered into this Memorandum in order that third parties may have notice of the existence of the unrecorded Shared Facilities Agreement and some of its specific provisions. This Memorandum is not a complete summary of the terms and conditions of the Shared Facilities Agreement. This Memorandum is not intended to amend, modify, or otherwise change the terms and conditions of the Shared Facilities Agreement. This Memorandum will not be used in interpreting the provisions of the Shared Facilities Agreement. In the event of a conflict between this Memorandum and the Shared Facilities Agreement, the Shared Facilities Agreement will in each instance control. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties, acting through their duly authorized representatives, have executed this Memorandum effective as of the Effective Date.

PUMPJACK SOLAR I, LLC MARKET BASED RATE TARIFF TARIFF VOLUME NO. 1
PUMPJACK SOLAR I, LLC MARKET BASED RATE TARIFF
1. Availability: Seller makes electric energy, capacity, and ancillary services available under this tariff to any purchaser, except as prohibited below. 2. Rates: All sales shall be made at rates established by agreement between the purchaser and Seller. 3. Compliance with Commission Regulations: Seller shall comply with the provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning seller's market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes seller to engage in affiliate sales under this tariff or otherwise restricts or limits the seller's market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning seller's market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this tariff. 4. Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority: a. Mitigated Sales: Seller does not have authority under this Tariff to make sales within the Duke Energy Carolinas, LLC balancing authority area, the Duke Energy Progress balancing authority areas, or in Peninsular Florida (the "Mitigated Markets"). See Duke Power, a Div. of Duke Energy Corp., 111 FERC ? 61,506, at P 61 (2005) (limitation on market-based rate sales within the Duke Energy Carolinas balancing authority area); Florida Power Corp., 113 FERC ? 61,131, at P 17 (2005) (limitations on market-based rate sales within the Duke Energy Progress balancing authority areas and Peninsular Florida); see also Duke Energy Corp., 136 FERC ? 61,245 (2011); Duke Energy Corp., 139 FERC ? 61,194 (2012). Any sales by Seller within the Mitigated Markets will be made in accordance with the rate schedules approved by the Commission prior to Seller commencing such sales. Peninsular Florida is defined for purposes of this Tariff as all of that portion of the State of Florida lying to the east of the Duke Energy Florida ("DEF") points of interconnection with Gulf Power Company, and to the south of the points of interconnection of those transmission lines jointly owned by Florida Power & Light Company and Jacksonville Electric Authority with Georgia Power Company and south of the points of interconnection of the City of Tallahassee and DEF with Georgia Power Company. See DeSoto County Generating Co., 106 FERC ? 61,100 (2004). b. Exemptions: Seller has been granted waivers of 18 C.F.R. Parts 41, 101 (with the exception that waiver of the provisions of Part 101 that apply to hydropower licensees is not granted with respect to licensed hydropower projects) and 141 of the Commission's regulations concerning accounting and periodic reporting requirements with the exception of sections 141.14 and 141.15. Seller has been granted waivers of Subparts B and C of Part 35 of the Commission's regulations requiring the filing of cost-of-service information, except as to sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15, and 35.16. Seller has been granted blanket authorization for all future issuances of securities or assumptions of liabilities pursuant to Section 204 of the Federal Power Act, 16 U.S.C. ? 824e, and Part 34 of the Commission's regulations. Pumpjack Solar I, LLC, ER17-361-000 (201_). 5. Ancillary Services: PJM: Seller offers regulation and frequency response service, energy imbalance service, and operating reserve service (which includes spinning, 10-minute, and 30-minute reserves) for sale into the market administered by PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. ("PJM") and, where the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff permits, the self-supply of these services to purchasers for a bilateral sale that is used to satisfy the ancillary services requirements of the PJM Office of Interconnection. New York: Seller offers regulation and frequency response service, and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute non-synchronous, 30-minute operating reserves, 10-minute spinning reserves, and 10-minute non-spinning reserves) for sale to purchasers in the market administered by the New York Independent System Operator, Inc. New England: Seller offers regulation and frequency response service (automatic generator control), operating reserve service (which includes 10-minute spinning reserve, 10-minute non-spinning reserve, and 30-minute operating reserve service) to purchasers within the markets administered by the ISO New England, Inc. California: Seller offers regulation service, spinning reserve service, and non-spinning reserve service to the California Independent System Operator Corporation ("CAISO") and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to the CAISO. MISO: Seller offers regulation service and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute spinning reserve and 10-minute supplemental reserve) for sale to the Midcontinent Independent System Operator, Inc. (MISO) and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to MISO. Southwest Power Pool: Seller offers regulation service and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute spinning reserve and 10-minute supplemental reserve) for sale to the Southwest Power Pool, Inc. (SPP) and to others that are self-supplying ancillary services to SPP. Third-party ancillary services: Seller offers Regulation and Frequency Response Service, Reactive Supply and Voltage Control Service, Energy and Generator Imbalance Service, Operating Reserve-Spinning, and Operating Reserve-Supplemental. Sales will not include the following: (1) sales to an RTO or an ISO, i.e., where that entity has no ability to self-supply ancillary services but instead depends on third parties; and (2) sales to a traditional, franchised public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier, or sales where the underlying transmission service is on the system of the public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier. Sales of Operating Reserve-Spinning and Operating Reserve-Supplemental will not include sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers, except where the Commission has granted authorization. Sales of Regulation and Frequency Response Service and Reactive Supply and Voltage Control Service will not include sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers, except at rates not to exceed the buying public utility transmission provider's OATT rate for the same service or where the Commission has granted authorization. 6. Seller Category: Seller is a Category 1 seller in all regions, as defined in 18 C.F.R. ? 35.36(a).
